Note, that dictionary includes all documents showed on the UI, moreover all adjusting documents whom applications may produce GL transactions. member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: A projection DAC over that is intended to close the gaps in AP history records. (The gaps in AP history records appear if AP history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system.) That is, the purpose of this DAC is to calculate the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record. For example, this projection is used in the Vendor Summary (AP401000) inquiry, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.BaseAPHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: A projection DAC over that is intended to close the gaps in AP history records. (The gaps in AP history records appear if AR history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system.) That is, the purpose of this DAC is to calculate the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record. For example, this projection is used in the Vendor Summary (AP401000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APQuickCheckTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for version of the (override).
Provides Tax calculation for , by default is attached to (details) and (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses graph, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of tran related to each AP Tran and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, APTaxAttribute
[APQuickCheckTax(typeof(Standalone.APQuickCheck), typeof(APTax), typeof(APTaxTran))]

summary.param: Type of parent(main) document. Must Be IBqlTable
Type of the TaxTran records for the row(details). Must be IBqlTable
Type of the TaxTran recorde for the main documect (summary). Must be iBqlTable

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APRetainedTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for feature version of the APTaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for amount in the line, by default is attached to (details) and (header).
Normally, should be placed on the field.
Internally, it uses graph, otherwise taxes will not be calculated ( is set to ).
As a result of this attribute work a set of tran related to each line and to their parent will be created
[APRetainedTaxAttribute(typeof(APRegister), typeof(APTax), typeof(APTaxTran))]

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.Standalone.APRegisterAlias2
member.summary: An alias descendant version of . Can be used e.g. to avoid behaviour when substitutes for derived classes. Can also be used as a table alias if is joined multiple times in BQL.
member.remarks: Contains all BQL fields from the base class, which is enforced by unit tests. This class should NOT override any properties. If you need such behaviour, derive from this class, do not alter it.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.CuryAPHistory
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Payable history record, which accumulates a number of important year-to-date and period-to-date amounts (such as sales, debit and credit adjustments, gains and losses) in foreign currency. The history is accumulated separately across the following dimensions: branch, GL account, GL subaccount, financial period, vendor, and currency. History records are created and updated during the document release process (see graph). Various helper projections over this DAC are used in a number of AR inquiry forms and reports, such as Vendor Summary (AP401000).

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AP.APScheduleMaint.RemoveApplications(PX.Objects.AP.Overrides.ScheduleMaint.DocumentSelection)
member.summary: Removes all application records associated with the specified document. This is required in order to prevent stuck application records after a document becomes scheduled.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust
member.summary: Records the fact of application of one Accounts Payable document to another, which results in an adjustment of the balances of both documents. It can be either an application of a payment document to an invoice document (for example, when a check closes a bill), or an application of one payment document to another, such as an application of a vendor refund to a prepayment. The entities of this type are mainly edited on the Checks and Payments (AP302000) form, which corresponds to the graph. They can also be edited on the Applications tab of the Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjdCuryRate

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.CuryDocBal
member.summary: The amount of the adjustment before the discount is taken. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.DocBal
member.summary: The amount of the adjustment before the discount is taken. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.CuryDiscBal
member.summary: The difference between the cash discount that was available and the actual amount of cash discount taken. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.DiscBal
member.summary: The difference between the cash discount that was available and the actual amount of cash discount taken. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.CuryWhTaxBal
member.summary: The difference between the amount of the tax to be withheld and the actual withheld amount (if any withholding taxes are applicable). (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.WhTaxBal
member.summary: The difference between the amount of the tax to be withheld and the actual withheld amount (if any withholding taxes are applicable). (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.VoidAppl
member.summary: When equal to true, indicates that the payment was voided or cancelled.
member.value: Setting this field to true will change the type of the adjusting document to Void Check ("VCK") and set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.ReverseGainLoss
member.summary: A read-only field, which when equal to true, indicates that the sign of the gain and loss is reversed for the adjustment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjgBalSign
member.summary: A read-only field showing the sign of the impact of the adjusting document on the balance. Depends only on the values of the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjgGLSign
member.summary: !REV! A read-only field showing the sign of impact of the adjusting document on the General Ledger. Depends only on the values of the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjgTBSign
member.summary: A read-only field showing the sign of impact of the adjusting document on the trial balance. Depends only on the values of the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjdTBSign
member.summary: A read-only field showing the sign of impact of the adjusted document on the trial balance. Depends only on the values of the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.SignedRGOLAmt
member.summary: A read-only field showing the Realized Gain and Loss amount associated with the adjustment with proper sign. Depends on the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.AdjdBalSign
member.summary: A read-only field showing the sign of the impact of the adjusted document on the balance. Depends only on the values of the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.TaxInvoiceNbr
member.summary: The "Tax Doc. Nbr" of the tax transaction, generated on the "Recognize Output/Input VAT" (TX503000/TX503500) form.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.IsMigratedRecord
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the record has been created in migration mode without affecting GL module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.IsInitialApplication
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this is the initial application created for a migrated document to affect all needed balances.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.PPDDebitAdjRefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the debit adjustment, generated on the "Generate VAT Debit Adjustments" (AP.50.45.00) form.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.CuryAdjdPPDAmt
member.summary: The cash discount amount displayed for the document. Given in the currency of the adjusted document.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APAdjust.displayDocType
member.summary: These fields are required to display two-way (incoming and outgoing) applications in a same grid: e.g. displaying the adjusting document number in case of an incoming application, and adjusted document number in case of an outgoing application. The fields are controlled by specific BLCs, e.g. filled out in delegates or by formula.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoiceType.RefNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized selector for APInvoice RefNbr.
By default, defines the following set of columns for the selector:
APInvoice.refNbr,APInvoice.docDate, APInvoice.finPeriodID,
APInvoice.vendorID, APInvoice.vendorID_Vendor_acctName,
APInvoice.vendorLocationID, APInvoice.curyID, APInvoice.curyOrigDocAmt,
APInvoice.curyDocBal,APInvoice.status, APInvoice.dueDate, APInvoice.invoiceNbr

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoiceType.NumberingAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for APInvoices version of the
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the AP Invoice.
References APInvoice.docType and APInvoice.docDate fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in AP Setup and APInvoice types:
namely APSetup.invoiceNumberingID, APSetup.adjustmentNumberingID,
APSetup.adjustmentNumberingID, APSetup.invoiceNumberingID

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoiceType.InvoiceListAttribute
member.summary:
String list with DocType, suitable for the APInvoice document.
Used in the DocType selector of APInvoices.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice
member.summary: Represents AP Invoices, Credit and Debit Adjustments. The DAC is based on and extends it with the fields relevant to the documents of the above types.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.BranchID
member.summary: Identifier of the Branch, to which the document belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the Branch.BranchID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DocType
member.summary: [key] Type of the document.
member.value: Possible values are: "INV" - Invoice, "ACR" - Credit Adjustment, "ADR" - Debit Adjustment, "PPM" - Prepayment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.RefNbr
member.summary: [key] Reference number of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.SuppliedByVendorID
member.summary: A reference to the .
member.value: An integer identifier of the vendor that supplied the goods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.SuppliedByVendorLocationID
member.summary: Identifier of the Location of the Supplied-by Vendor, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Defaults to AP bill's vendor location.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.TermsID
member.summary: The credit terms associated with the document (unavailable for prepayments and debit adjustments).\ Defaults to the credit terms of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DueDate
member.summary: The date when payment for the document is due in accordance with the credit terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DiscDate
member.summary: The date when the cash discount can be taken in accordance with the credit terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.MasterRefNbr
member.summary: For an installment this field holds the reference number of the master document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.InstallmentNbr
member.summary: The number of the installment, which the document represents.
member.value: Corresponds to the TermsInstallments.InstallmentNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.InstallmentCntr
member.summary: Counter of the document's installments.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.InvoiceNbr
member.summary: The document’s original reference number as assigned by the vendor (for informational purposes). The reference to the vendor document is required if is set to true. The reference should also be unique if is set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.InvoiceDate
member.summary: The document’s original date as assigned by the vendor (for informational purposes).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.TaxZoneID
member.summary: Identifier of the tax zone associated with the document. Defaults to vendor's tax zone.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryTaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.TaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryLineTotal
member.summary: The document total presented in the currency of the document. (See )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.LineTotal
member.summary: The document total presented in the base currency of the company. (See )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryVatExemptTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are marked as exempt and are neither statistical nor reverse. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.VatExemptTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are marked as exempt and are neither statistical nor reverse. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryVatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total, which is subject to VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are neither exempt, nor statistical, nor reverse. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.VatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The part of the document total, which is subject to VAT. This total is calculated as a sum of the taxable amounts for the taxes of type VAT, which are neither exempt, nor statistical, nor reverse. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.CuryInitDocBal
member.summary: The entered in migration mode balance of the document. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DrCr
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document is of debit or credit type. The value of this field is based solely on the field.
member.value: Possible values are "D" (for Invoice, Credit Adjustment, Prepayment, Quick Check) and "C" (for Debit Adjustment and Void Quick Check).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.SeparateCheck
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document should be paid for by a separate check. In other words, the payment to such a document must not be consolidated with other payments.
member.value: Defaults to the value of the same setting for vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PaySel
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document is approved for payment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayLocationID
member.summary: location for payment.
member.value: Defaults to vendor's default location or to the first active location of the vendor if the former is not set.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayDate
member.summary: The date when the bill has been approved for payment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayTypeID
member.summary: The payment method used for the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the PaymentMethod.PaymentMethodID field. Defaults to the payment method associated with the vendor location.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PayAccountID
member.summary: The cash account used for the payment.
member.value: Defaults to the cash account associated with the selected location and payment method. In case such account is not found the default value will be the cash account which is specified as default for AP for the selected payment method.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PrebookAcctID
member.summary: The expense account used to record the expenses pending reclassification. The field is relevant only if the Support for Expense Reclassification feature is activated and the document has or has had the Prebooked ("K") status. (See )
member.value: Defaults to the account associated with the vendor of the document. Corresponds to the AccountID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.PrebookSubID
member.summary: The subaccount used to record the expenses pending reclassification. The field is relevant only if the Support for Expense Reclassification feature is activated and the document has or has had the Prebooked ("K") status. (See )
member.value: Defaults to the subaccount associated with the vendor of the document. Corresponds to the AccountID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.EstPayDate
member.summary: Estimated payment date.
member.value: The field is calculated and equals either if the document is selected for payment or the otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.LCEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether landed cost is enabled for the document.
member.value: Equals true if the vendor of the document is a Landed Cost vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.IsTaxDocument
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document is tax bill and orginally has been created by tax reporting process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APInvoice.DontApprove
member.summary: Indicates that the current document should be excluded from the approval process.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment
member.summary: Represents Checks, Debit Adjustments, Prepayments, Refunds and Void Checks in Accounts Payable module. This DAC extends with the fields specific to the documents of the above types.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DocType
member.summary: [key] Type of the document.
member.value: Possible values are: "CHK" - Check, "ADR" - Debit Adjustment, "PPM" - Prepayment, "REF" - Refund, "VCK" - Void Check

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RefNbr
member.summary: [key] Reference number of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RemitAddressID
member.summary: Remittance address for the document.
member.value: Defaults to the remittance address of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.RemitContactID
member.summary: Remittance contact for the document.
member.value: Defaults to the remittance contact of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.BranchID
member.summary: Identifier of the Branch, to which the document belongs. The field must be located before the and fields for correct Restriction Groups operation.
member.value: Corresponds to the Branch.BranchID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.PaymentMethodID
member.summary: The payment method used for the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the PaymentMethod.PaymentMethodID field. Defaults to the payment method associated with the vendor location.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CashAccountID
member.summary: The cash account associated with the payment method. The field is irrelevant for debit adjustments.
member.value: Corresponds to the CashAccount.CashAccountID field. Defaults to the cash account associated with the payment method and location.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.ExtRefNbr
member.summary: A payment reference number, which can be a system-generated number or an external reference number (such as a wire transfer number or a bank check number) entered manually. Irrelevant for Debit Adjustments.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.AdjDate
member.summary: The date when the payment is applied.
member.value: Defaults to the current business date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.AdjFinPeriodID
member.summary: The financial period of payment application.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field, but can be overriden manually.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.AdjTranPeriodID
member.summary: The financial period of payment application.
member.value: Unlike the , the value of this field is determined solely by the field and can't be overriden.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DocDate
member.summary: The date of the payment document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.TranPeriodID
member.summary: The financial period of the document corresponding to the payment date.
member.value: Unlike the , the value of this field is determined solely by the field and can't be overriden.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.FinPeriodID
member.summary: The financial period of the document.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field, but can be overriden manually.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CuryOrigDocAmt
member.summary: The total payment amount that should be applied to the documents. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.StubCntr
member.summary: The counter of the related pay stubs. Note that this field is used internally for numbering purposes and its value may not reflect the actual count of the pay stubs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.BillCntr
member.summary: The counter of the related bills. Note that this field is used internally for numbering purposes and its value may not reflect the actual count of the bills.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.ChargeCntr
member.summary: The counter of the related charge entries. Note that this field is used internally for numbering purposes and its value may not reflect the actual count of the charges.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CuryUnappliedBal
member.summary: The balance that has not been applied. This will be a nonzero value if the payment amount is not equal to a document’s total amount. Checks shall always have a zero unapplied balance. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.UnappliedBal
member.summary: The balance that has not been applied. This will be a nonzero value if the payment amount is not equal to a document’s total amount. Checks shall always have a zero unapplied balance. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CuryInitDocBal
member.summary: The entered in migration mode balance of the document. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CuryApplAmt
member.summary: The amount to be applied on the application date. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.ApplAmt
member.summary: The amount to be applied on the application date. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.Cleared
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the check was cleared in the process of reconciliation.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.ClearDate
member.summary: The date when the check was cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.Voided
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document was voided. In this case field will hold the number of the voiding .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.PrintCheck
member.summary: When set to true indicates that a check must be printed for the payment represented by this record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.IsPrintingProcess
member.summary: Indicates that this check under printing processing to prevent update table by />

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.IsReleaseCheckProcess
member.summary: Indicates that this check under release processing to prevent the question about the saving of the last check number by />

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.VoidAppl
member.summary: When true indicates that the document is Void Check.
member.value: Setting this field to true will change the type of the document to Void Check ("VCK").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CanHaveBalance
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document can have balance.
member.value: true for Debit Adjustments, Prepayments, Quick Checks and Void Checks. false for other documents.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DrCr
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document is of debit or credit type. The value of this field is based solely on the field.
member.value: Possible values are "D" (for Refund and Void Quick Check) and "C" (for Check, Void Check, Debit Adjustment, Prepayment and Quick Check).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.CATranID
member.summary: Identifier of the related transaction in Cash Management module.

member.summary: Returns the word representation of the amount of the document. (English only)

member.summary: Together with the and the field is used to link the payment to the appropriate Cash Management entities (See , , ) during the payments reclassification process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DiscDate
member.summary: Doesn't bear any meaning in the context of records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.DepositAsBatch
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the payment can be included in a deposit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APPayment.Status
member.summary: Status of the document. The field is calculated based on the values of status flag. It can't be changed directly. The fields tht determine status of a document are: , , , , ,

member.summary: The total prepayment amount that should be applied to the PO Orders.

member.summary: The total prepayment amount (released and not, request and not documents) that should be applied to the PO Orders. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APAROrd
member.summary: An auxiliary DAC that is used in Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable balance reports to properly join documents with their adjustments.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APAROrd.Ord
member.summary: [key] The field is used in reports for joining and filtering purposes.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister
member.summary: Primary DAC for the Accounts Payable documents. Includes fields common to all types of AP documents.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing or not.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.HiddenKey
member.summary: If not null, this field indicates that the document represents a payment by a separate check. In this case the payment cannot be combined with other payments to the vendor. Applicable only in case VSeparateCheck option is turned on for the Vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.BranchID
member.summary: Identifier of the Branch, to which the document belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the Branch.BranchID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.DocType
member.summary: [key] Type of the document.
member.value: Possible values are: "INV" - Invoice, "ACR" - Credit Adjustment, "ADR" - Debit Adjustment, "CHK" - Check, "VCK" - Void Check, "PPM" - Prepayment, "REF" - Vendor Refund, "QCK" - Quick Check, "VQC" - Void Quick Check.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.PrintDocType
member.summary: Type of the document for displaying in reports. This field has the same set of possible internal values as the field, but exposes different user-friendly values.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.RefNbr
member.summary: [key] Reference number of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.OrigModule
member.summary: Module, from which the document originates.
member.value: Code of the module of the system. Defaults to "AP". Possible values are: "GL", "AP", "AR", "CM", "CA", "IN", "DR", "FA", "PM", "TX", "SO", "PO".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.LineCntr

member.value: Possible values are: "N" - for Invoice, Credit Adjustment, Debit Adjustment, Quick Check and Void Quick Check; "P" - for Check, Void Check and Refund; "U" - for Prepayment.

member.summary: When set, on persist checks, that the document has the corresponded original value. When not set, on persist checks, that value is not changed. Throws an error otherwise.

member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document was voided. In this case field will hold the number of the voiding .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.Payable
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document is payable. Depends solely on the APRegister.DocType field. Opposite to field.
member.value: true - for payable documents, e.g. bills; false - for paying, e.g. checks.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.Paying
member.summary: Read-only field indicating whether the document is paying. Depends solely on the APRegister.DocType field. Opposite to field.
member.value: true - for paying documents, e.g. checks; false - for payable ones, e.g. bills.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.SortOrder
member.summary: Read-only field determining the sort order for AP documents based on the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.SignBalance
member.summary: Read-only field indicating the sign of the document's impact on AP balance . Depends solely on the
member.value: Can be 1, -1 or 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.SignAmount
member.summary: Read-only field indicating the sign of the document amount. Depends solely on the
member.value: Can be 1, -1 or 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.Status
member.summary: Status of the document. The field is calculated based on the values of status flag. It can't be changed directly. The fields tht determine status of a document are: , , , , , , , .
member.value: Possible values are: "H" - Hold, "B" - Balanced, "V" - Voided, "S" - Scheduled, "N" - Open, "C" - Closed, "P" - Printed, "K" - Prebooked, "E" - Pending Approval, "R" - Rejected, "Z" - Reserved. Defaults to Hold.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.ScheduleID
member.summary: Identifier of the Schedule object, associated with the document. In case is true, ScheduleID points to the Schedule, to which the document belongs as a template. Otherwise, ScheduleID points to the Schedule, from which this document was generated, if any.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.ImpRefNbr
member.summary: Implementation specific reference number of the document. This field is neither filled nor used by the core Acumatica itself, but may be utilized by customizations or extensions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxValid
member.summary: When true, indicates that the amount of tax calculated with the External Tax Provider is up to date. If this field equals false, the document was updated since last synchronization with the Tax Engine and taxes might need recalculation.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxPosted
member.summary: When true, indicates that the tax information was successfully commited to the External Tax Provider.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsTaxSaved
member.summary: Indicates whether the tax information related to the document was saved to the External Tax Provider.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.NonTaxable
member.summary: Get or set NonTaxable that mark current document does not impose sales taxes.

member.summary: Reference number of the original (source) document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.ReleasedOrPrebooked
member.summary: Read-only field that is equal to true in case the document was either prebooked or released.

member.summary: The workgroup that is responsible for document approval process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.OwnerID
member.summary: The employee responsible for document approval process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.IsMigratedRecord
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the record has been created in migration mode without affecting GL module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APRegister.PaymentsByLinesAllowed
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the record has been created with activated feature and such document allow payments by lines.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup
member.summary: Allows to configure the Accounts Payable module. Some of the settings, such as numbering sequences, cannot be changed once the module is in use.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.BatchNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for batches generated by the Accounts Payable module.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DfltVendorClassID
member.summary: The vendor class to be used as the default vendor class. When a new vendor class is created using the Vendor Classes (AP.20.10.00) form, the settings defined for the class specified here will be inserted into the appropriate boxes.
member.value: Refers the DAC.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PerRetainTran
member.summary: Defines the number of periods, during which the batches generated by the Accounts Payable module will be stored in the database. Increasing this value later, after some period of use, is not recommended, because the history deleted from the database cannot be restored and some reports will be incomplete.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PerRetainHist
member.summary: Defines the number of periods, during which the Accounts Payable module history will be stored in the database. Increasing this value later, after some period of use, is not recommended, because the history deleted from the database cannot be restored and some reports will be incomplete.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoiceNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for Accounts Payable bills.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue00
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the first category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue01
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the second category. If the value here is greater than the PastDue00 value, documents from the first category are not included in the second category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PastDue02
member.summary: The maximum number of days outstanding or past due for the document to be included in the third category. If the value here is greater than the PastDue01 value, documents from the second category are not included in the third category.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.CheckNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for Accounts Payable payments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.CreditAdjNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for credit adjustments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DebitAdjNumberingID
member.summary: The numbering sequence used for debit adjustments.
member.value: This field is a link to a record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.DefaultTranDesc
member.summary: Default way to populate description for new transactions.
member.value: "C" - Combination of Vendor ID and Name, "I" - Vendor ID, "N" - Vendor Name, "U" - description entered by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.ExpenseSubMask
member.summary: The subaccount mask that defines the rule of choosing segment values for the expense subaccount to be used for non-stock items on data entry forms in the Accounts Payable module. To set up the rule, select a segment, press F3, and choose a source of the segment value, which is one of the following options:
member.value: The mask may include the following characters: C: Expense subaccount associated with branch E: Subaccount associated with employee I: Subaccount associated with non-stock item L: Subaccount associated with vendor location For a segment, the characters designating each option are repeated as many times as there are characters in the segment.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.AutoPost
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that transactions will be automatically posted to the General Ledger once they are released in the Accounts Payable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.TransactionPosting
member.summary: Indicates whether to post transactions to GL as summary or in detailed mode. Is set by the field.
member.value: "S" - Summary, "D" - Detail. Defaults to Detail.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.SummaryPost
member.summary: Indicates whether to post transactions to GL as summary or in detailed mode. This field depends on and changes field when set.
member.value: true indicates that summary should be posted (corresponds to "S" value of the field.)

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireApprovePayments
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that approval of bills is required before bills may be paid. Bills can be approved using the Approve Bills for Payment (AP.50.20.00) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: If set to true, adds the Amount box to the Summary area of the Bills and Adjustments (AP.30.10.00) form. To save a document in the Balanced status, the user must enter the document total in this box after reviewing the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: If set to true, new documents will have the On Hold status by default, which prevents them from being released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.EarlyChecks
member.summary: If set to true, allows to enter and print checks for bills, belonging to future periods.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RequireVendorRef
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that users must fill in Vendor Ref. () on data entry forms in the Accounts Payable, Taxes and Purchase Orders modules. Also this check box controls the Ext. Ref. Number box (GLTranDoc.ExtRefNbr) on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form of the General Ledger module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.PaymentLeadTime
member.summary: The number of days on average required for a payment to reach a vendor location. This value is used as a default value for multiple boxes on the Approve Bills for Payment (AP.50.20.00) and Prepare Payments (AP.50.30.00) forms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoicePrecision
member.summary: Determines the smallest value to round bills amount to. Doesn't have any effect unless Invoice Rounding feature is enabled. If Rounding Rule () is set to Use Currency Precision ("N") the value of this field similarly does not affect rounding.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.InvoiceRounding
member.summary: Determines the rule to be used to round bills total amounts. Doesn't have any effect unless Invoice Rounding feature is enabled. Smallest unit to round to is determined by the precision of the Currency if Use Currency Precision is selected, or by the value of the field otherwise.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Use Currency Precision: To round the totals to the decimal precision supported by the currency of the document. (See Currency.DecimalPlaces field.) "R" - Nearest: To round each bill total to the nearest multiple of the smallest unit (specified in the Rounding Precision box). (Mathematical rounding) "C" - Up: To round up each bill total to the next multiple of the smallest unit. "F" - Down: To round down each bill total to the previous multiple of the smallest unit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RaiseErrorOnDoubleInvoiceNbr
member.summary: When set to true, makes the system generate errors when a new document is created with a value in the Vendor Ref. box that has already been used in the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.LoadVendorsPricesUsingAlternateID
member.summary: When set to true, makes it possible to load Vendor Prices by alternate ID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.RetentionType
member.summary: The way the history of prices will be retained.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.NumberOfMonths
member.summary: The number of months the history of price changes should be kept. This field is relevant if the Fixed Number of Months ("F") option is selected in the .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APSetup.MigrationMode
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that migration mode is activated for the AP module. In other words, this gives an ability to create the document with starting balance without any applications.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APTax
member.summary: Represents a line-level tax detail of an Accounts Payable document. The entities of this type cannot be edited directly. Instead, descendants aggregate them to records, which can be edited on the Bills and Adjustments (AR301000) and Quick Checks (AP304000) forms (corresponding to the and graphs, recpectively).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APTran
member.summary: Represents the individual lines of the Accounts Payable documents.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing or not.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.BranchID

member.value: Corresponds to the Branch.BranchID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.TranType
member.summary: [key] The type of the transaction.
member.value: The field is determined by the type of the parent document. For the list of possible values see .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.RefNbr
member.summary: [key] Reference number of the parent document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.LineNbr
member.summary: [key] The number of the transaction line in the document.
member.value: Note that the sequence of line numbers of the transactions belonging to a single document may include gaps.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.TranID
member.summary: Internal unique identifier of the transaction line.
member.value: The value is an auto-generated database identity.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.VendorID
member.summary: Identifier of the , whom the parent document belongs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.SuppliedByVendorID
member.summary: A reference to the . This is non-database field. The field needs only for the discount calculation
member.value: An integer identifier of the vendor that supplied the goods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.LineType
member.summary: The type of the transaction line. This field is used to distinguish Discount lines from other ones.
member.value: Equals "DS" for discounts, "LA" for landed-cost transactions created in AP, "LP" for landed-cost transactions created from PO, and empty string for common lines.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.POOrderType
member.summary: The type of the corresponding PO Order. Together with and links APTrans to the PO Orders and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POOrder.OrderType field. See its description for the list of allowed values.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.PONbr
member.summary: The reference number of the corresponding PO Order. Together with and links APTrans to the PO Orders and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POOrder.OrderNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.POLineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the corresponding PO Line. Together with and links AP transactions to the PO Orders and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POLine.LineNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.LCDocType
member.summary: The type of the corresponding Landed Cost Document. Together with and links APTrans to the PO Orders and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POOrder.OrderType field. See its description for the list of allowed values.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.LCRefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the corresponding Landed Cost Document. Together with and links APTrans to the PO Orders and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POLandedCostDoc.RefNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.LCLineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the corresponding Landed Cost Document Detail. Together with and links AP transactions to the Landed Cost Document and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POLine.LineNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.ReceiptNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the corresponding PO Receipt. Together with field links AP transactions to PO Receipts and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POReceipt.ReceiptNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.ReceiptLineNbr
member.summary: The number of the corresponding line in the related PO Receipt. Together with field links AP transactions to PO Receipts and their lines.
member.value: Corresponds to the POReceiptLine.LineNbr field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.InventoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the inventory item associated with the transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the InventoryItem.InventoryID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.AccrueCost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that cost will be processed using expense accrual account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.AccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the expense account to be updated by the transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the Account.AccountID field. Defaults to the Cost of Goods Sold account associated with the inventory item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.SubID
member.summary: Identifier of the Subaccount associated with the transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the Sub.SubID field. Defaults to the Cost of Goods Sold subaccount associated with the inventory item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.ProjectID
member.summary: The project with which the item is associated or the non-project code if the item is not intended for any project. The field is relevant only if the Project Module is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the PMProject.ProjectID field. Defaults to the default project of the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.TaskID
member.summary: Identifier of the particular task associated with the transaction. The task belongs to the selected project
member.value: Corresponds to the PMTask.TaskID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.Box1099
member.summary: Identifier of the 1099 Box associated with the line.
member.value: Defaults to the 1099 Box associated with the expense account or with the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.TaxID
member.summary: The identifier of the tax associated with the line.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.APTran.DeferredCode

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APHistory
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Payable history record, which accumulates a number of important year-to-date and period-to-date amounts (such as purchases, debit and credit adjustments, gains and losses) in base currency. The history is accumulated separately across the following dimensions: branch, GL account, GL subaccount, financial period, and vendor. History records are created and updated during the document release process (see graph). Various helper projections over this DAC are used in a number of AR inquiry forms and reports, such as Vendor Summary (AP401000).

if it exists - so it must include both records. See example above.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute implements auto-generation of the next check sequential number for APPayment Document
according to the settings in the CashAccount and PaymentMethod.
It's also creates and inserts a related record into the CashAccountCheck table
and keeps it in synch. with AP Payment (delets it if the the payment is deleted.
Depends upon CashAccountID, PaymentMethodID, StubCntr fields of the row.
Cache(s) for the CashAccountCheck must be present in the graph

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute.UpdateCashManager
member.summary:
This flag defines wether the field is defaulted from the PaymentMethodAccount record by the next check number
If it set to false - the field on which attribute is set will not be initialized by the next value.
This flag doesn't affect persisting behavior - if user enter next number manually, it will be saved.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AP.PaymentRefAttribute.Table
member.summary:
Defines a table, from where oldValue of the field is taken from.
If not set - the table associated with the sender will be used

member.param: Row. If omited, Field is set as altered for the cache

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for AP version of the TaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for APTran, by default is attached to APTran (details) and APInvoice (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses APInvoiceEntry graphs, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of APTax tran related to each AP Tran and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, APTaxAttribute
[APTax(typeof(APRegister), typeof(APTax), typeof(APTaxTran))]

summary.param: Type of parent(main) document. Must Be IBqlTable
Type of the TaxTran records for the row(details). Must be IBqlTable
Type of the TaxTran recorde for the main documect (summary). Must be iBqlTable

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.APCashTranIDAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for the APPayment version of the
Since CATran created from the source row, it may be used only the fields
of APPayment compatible DAC.
The main purpuse of the attribute - to create CATran
for the source row and provide CATran and source synchronization on persisting.
CATran cache must exists in the calling Graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AP.ToWordsAttribute

Converts Decimal value to it's word representation (English only) one way only
For example, 1921.14 would be converted to "One thousand nine hundred twenty one and fourteen".
Should be placed on the string field
[ToWords(typeof(APPayment.curyOrigDocAmt))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Common.Aging.AgingEngine.AgeByDays(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,PX.Objects.Common.Aging.AgingDirection,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Given the current date and the aging bucket boundaries (in maximum inclusive days from the current date), calculates the days difference between the current date and the test date, returning a zero-based number of aging bucket that the test date falls into.
member.param: Upper inclusive boundaries, in days, of the aging buckets. The first element of this sequence defines the upper inclusive boundary of the current bucket (it is usually zero). The total number of buckets would be equal to the number of elements in the sequence, plus one. The values in the sequence should be strictly non-decreasing.
member.returns: The number of the aging bucket that the falls into, in the [0; N] interval, where N is the the number of elements in . The value of N corresponds to the last aging bucket, which encompasses all dates that exceed the maximum bucket boundary.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Common.Aging.AgingEngine.AgeByPeriods(System.DateTime,System.DateTime,PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriods.IFinPeriodRepository,PX.Objects.Common.Aging.AgingDirection,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given the current date and the number of period-based aging buckets, returns the zero-based number of bucket that the specified test date falls into.
member.param: The total number of period-based buckets, including the "Current" and "Over" bucket. For backwards aging, the "Current" bucket encompasses dates in the same (or later) financial period as the current date, and the "Over" bucket corresponds to dates that are at least (numberOfBuckets - 1) periods back in time from the current date.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARAdjust
member.summary: Records the fact of application of one Accounts Receivable document to another, which results in an adjustment of the balances of both documents. It can be either an application of a payment document to an invoice document (for example, when a payment closes an invoice), or an application of one payment document to another, such as an application of a customer refund to a payment. The entities of this type are mainly edited on the Payments and Applications (AR302000) form, which corresponds to the graph. They can also be edited on the Applications tab of the Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BQL.IsSelfVoidingVoidApplication`1
member.summary: A predicate that returns true if and only if the application record is produced by the voiding process for one of the Accounts Receivable self-voiding documents. Due to the fact that there is no separate voiding document record for self-voiding documents, such applications should be separately reported in .

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BQL.IsSelfVoiding`1
member.summary: A predicate that returns true if and only if the document type represented by the generic type passed corresponds to one of the Accounts Receivable self-voiding documents, which do not create a separate voiding document: instead, all their applications are reversed.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BQL.IsNotSelfApplying`1
member.summary: A predicate which returns true whenever the value of its operand field does not correspond to a self-applying document, which has no balance, e.g. a Cash Sale or a Cash Return.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BQL.HasUnreleasedVoidPayment`2
member.summary: A predicate that returns true if and only if the payment defined by its key fields (document type and reference number) has an unreleased void payment. This may be needed to exclude such payments from processing to prevent creating unnecessary applications, see e.g. the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BQL.IsSchedulable`1
member.summary: A predicate that returns true if and only if the descendant record can be added to a recurring transaction schedule.
member.remarks: Due to the absence of Exists<> BQL predicate, the BQL implementation of the current predicate does not check for the presence of records referencing the document record. It should be done separately via a left join and a null check. See for example and details.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsIncomingApplication
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the application detail is incoming relative to the parent Customer Statement record. If and only if this flag is set to true, the ending balance of the parent statement will account for the write-off, RGOL, and cash discount amounts contained in the application.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsOutgoingApplication
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the application detail is outgoing relative to the parent Customer Statement record. When this flag is set to true, the ending balance of the parent statement will not account for the GL amounts contained in the application, such as write-off, RGOL, and cash discount amounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsInterBranchApplication
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that the parent application affects documents that originate in different branches.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsInterCurrencyApplication
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that the parent application affects documents that have different currencies.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsInterCustomerApplication
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that the parent application affects documents that belong to different customers.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.IsInterStatementApplication
member.summary: If set to true, indicates that the parent application affects two Customer Statements at once. If and only if this flag is set to true, the ending balance of the parent statement will account for the application amount.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementAdjust.signBalanceDelta

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountSequenceDetail
member.summary: Represents one of the two discount breakpoint records created for each records. The record stores (depending on the value of the flag) either the current or the pending break quantity or amount, and either the current or the pending discount percentage or amount. The entities of this type cannot be edited directly, but are aggregated into discount breakpoint records on the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.summary: The method to calculate expected GL turnover values for all selected documents and their applications. Note, that dictionary includes all documents showed on the UI, moreover all adjusting documents whom applications may produce GL transactions. We need all such documents to reconcile correctly turnover values between GL and AR modules because all GL transactions producing by applications are always marked as adjusting document transactions (except CreditWO documents).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.BaseARHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: A projection DAC over that is intended to close the gaps in AR history records. (The gaps in AR history records appear if AR history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system.) That is, the purpose of this DAC is to calculate the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record. For example, this projection is used in the Customer Summary (AR401000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: A projection DAC over that is intended to close the gaps in AR history records. (The gaps in AR history records appear if AR history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system.) That is, the purpose of this DAC is to calculate the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record. For example, this projection is used in the Customer Summary (AR401000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARCustomerBalanceEnq.ARHistorySummary.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the delegate calculated the summary.

Static function for release of AR documents and posting of the released batch. Released batches will be posted if the corresponded flag in ARSetup is set to true. SkipPost parameter is used to override this flag. This function can not be called from inside of the covering DB transaction scope, unless skipPost is set to true.
member.param: List of the documents to be released
Flag specifing if the function is called from mass process - affects error handling
List of batches that should not be posted inside the release procedure
Delegate to be called if release process completed successfully
Delegate to be called inside the transaction scope of AR document release process

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AR.ARFinChargesApplyMaint.GetCustomerIDsWithoutChargeableInvoices
member.remarks: Used for coarse filtration of customers in the inner loop of so as to skip (and avoid redundant DB selects / processing) those customers who don't have any chargeable documents. Checks if all customers belonging to the specified statement cyclehave their statement date updated (i.e. they have been properly processed by the

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AR.StatementCycleProcessBO.UpdateDocumentsLastStatementDate(PX.Data.PXGraph,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Used for open item statement processing. Updates all documents of the customers that do not yet have an , regardless of whether the document has got into statement. This is done so that if the customer switches to BBF statement type, the documents that didn't get into BBF statements don't suddenly appear in the new statements.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AR.StatementCycleProcessBO.UpdateDocumentsLastStatementDate(PX.Data.PXGraph,PX.Objects.AR.ARStatement)
M:PX.Objects.AR.StatementCycleProcessBO.ResetDocumentsLastStatementDate(PX.Data.PXGraph,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Used for statement re-generation, when the old statement objects are deleted. In order for the documents to re-appear in the new statement, their statement date needs to be reset to null.
member.remarks: It is insufficient to just update documents for which matching statement details exist, because in case of switching from Open Item to BBF, some documents could have been closed at the moment of Open Item processing, and no was created for them.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.AR.StatementCycleProcessBO.UpdateApplicationsLastStatementDate(PX.Data.PXGraph,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARBalances
member.summary: Represents a balance record of an Accounts Receivable customer. Customer balances are accumulated into records across the following dimensions: branch, customer, and customer location. The balance records are created and updated by the graph during the document release process.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARFinCharge
member.summary: Represents an overdue charge code, which is used to calculate overdue charges used for late payments in the collection process. The record encapsulates various information about the overdue charge, such as the calculation method, overdue fee rates, and overdue GL accounts. The entities of this type are created and edited on the Overdue Charges (AR204500) form, which corresponds to the graph. The overdue charge codes are then used in the Calculate Overdue Charges (AR507000) processing, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARHistory
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable history record, which accumulates a number of important year-to-date and period-to-date amounts (such as sales, debit/credit adjustments, and gains/losses) in base currency. The history is accumulated separately across the following dimensions: branch, GL account, GL subaccount, financial period, and customer. History records are created and updated during the document release process (see graph). Various helper projections over this DAC are used in a number of AR inquiry forms and reports, such as Customer Summary (AR401000).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARPayment
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable payment or a payment-like document, which can have one of the types defined by , such as credit memo, customer refund, or balance write-off. The entities of this type are edited on the Payments and Applications (AR302000) form, which corresponds to the graph.
member.remarks: Credit memo, cash sale and cash return documents consist of both an invoice record and a corresponding payment record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARPayment.CuryInitDocBal
member.summary: The entered in migration mode balance of the document. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARPayment.NeedTaskValidation
member.summary: Indicates whether validation for the presence of the correct must be performed for the line before it is persisted to the database.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARSalesPerTran
member.summary: Represents a sales person commission of an Accounts Receivable invoice. The records of this type are created automatically when the user specifies a salesperson ID in an invoice line on the Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARSPCommissionPeriod
member.summary: Represents a period of a commission year, for which salesperson commissions are calculated by the Calculate Commissions (AR505500) process. The number of periods in a commission is regulated by the commission period type, which is specified on the Accounts Receivable Preferences (AR101000) form. The entities of this type are created during the Calculate Commissions (AR505500) process, which corresponds to the graph. Commission periods are closed on the Close Commission Period (AR506500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARSPCommissionYear
member.summary: Represents a year in which salesperson commissions are calculated and to which commission periods () belong. The records of this type are created during the Calculate Commissions (AR505500) process, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARSPCommnHistory
member.summary: Represents aggregate historical information about commissions calculated for a given salesperson in a given financial period, additionally broken down by branch, customer, and customer location. The records of this type are created by the Calculate Commissions process, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran
member.summary: Represents a tax detail of an Accounts Receivable document. This is a projection DAC over restricted by the Accounts Receivable module. The entities of this type are edited on the Invoices and Memos (AR301000) and Cash Sales (AR304000) forms, which correspond to the and graphs, respectively.
member.remarks: Tax details are aggregates combined by from line-level records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.RecordID
member.summary: This is an auto-numbered field, which is a part of the primary key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.CuryExemptedAmt
member.summary: The exempted amount in the record currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.ExemptedAmt
member.summary: The exempted amount in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.CuryDiscountedTaxableAmt
member.summary: The taxable amount reduced on early payment, according to cash discount. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.DiscountedTaxableAmt
member.summary: The taxable amount reduced on early payment, according to cash discount. Given in the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.CuryDiscountedPrice
member.summary: The tax amount reduced on early payment, according to cash discount. Given in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARTaxTran.DiscountedPrice
member.summary: The tax amount reduced on early payment, according to cash discount. Given in the base currency of the company.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.CuryARHistory
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable history record, which accumulates a number of important year-to-date and period-to-date amounts (such as sales, debit/credit adjustments, and gains/losses) in foreign currency. The history is accumulated separately across the following dimensions: branch, GL account, GL subaccount, financial period, customer, and currency. History records are created and updated during the document release process (see graph). Various helper projections over this DAC are used in a number of AR inquiry forms and reports, such as Customer Summary (AR401000).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.CustomerPaymentMethod
member.summary: Represents the customer-specific settings of a payment method. For instance payment methods (such as credit cards), a customer payment method record is obligatory and defines all details (see ) necessary to use the method to record payments. For generic payment methods (such as cash or wire transfer), the presence of a customer-specific payment method record is optional, but it can nevertheless be defined to override the default payment method settings. The entities of this type are edited on the Customer Payment Methods (AR303010) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.CustomerPaymentMethod.Selected
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the payment method record has been selected for processing.
member.value: This is a non-database bound field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.CustomerPaymentMethod.BAccountID

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.CustSalesPeople
member.summary: Represents a salesperson associated with a customer location. The entity implements the many-to-many relationship between customer locations and salespeople. For a salesperson, records of this type allow to specify different default commission percentages for different customer locations. The entities of this type can be edited on the Salespersons (AR205000) form, which corresponds to the graph. They can also be edited on the Salespersons tab of the Customer (AR303000) form, which corresponds to the graph.
member.remarks: When a user specifies a salesperson in an invoice line, the system looks for a record that corresponds to the customer and location specified in the invoice, and defaults the value of from the value of . If such a record does not exist, the system takes the default commission percentage of the salesperson.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.CustSalesPeople.SalesPersonID

member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.summary: The default sales commission percentage received by the salesperson for the specified customer and location.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.SalesPerson
member.summary: Represents a salesperson who can be associated with sales of stock and non-stock items in the system. To associate a salesperson with a sale, a salesperson's identifier is recorded in a sales order or invoice line ( and ). The entities of this type can be edited on the Salespersons (AR205000) form, which corresponds to the graph.
member.remarks: A salesperson can be matched to a company employee through its field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoiceNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for ARInvoice version of the InvoiceNbrAttribute.
The main purpose of the attribute is poviding of the uniqueness of the RefNbr
amoung a set of documents of the specifyed types (for example, each RefNbr of the ARInvoice
the ARInvoices must be unique across all ARInvoices and AR Debit memos)
This may be useful, if user has configured a manual numberin for ARInvoices
or needs to create ARInvoice from another document (like SOOrder) allowing to type RefNbr
for the to-be-created Invoice manually. To store the numbers, system using ARInvoiceNbr table,
keyed uniquelly by DocType and RefNbr. A source document is linked to a number by NoteID.
Attributes checks a number for uniqueness on FieldVerifying and RowPersisting events.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.CustomerRawAttribute
member.summary:
Provides a UI Selector for Customers AcctCD as a string.
Should be used where the definition of the AccountCD is needed - mostly, in a Customer DAC class.
Properties of the selector - mask, length of the key, etc.
are defined in the Dimension with predefined name "CUSTOMER".
By default, search uses the following tables (linked) BAccount, Customer (strict), Contact, Address (optional).
List of the Customers is filtered based on the user's access rights.
Default column's list in the Selector - Customer.acctCD, Customer.acctName,
Customer.customerClassID, Customer.status, Contact.phone1, Address.city, Address.countryID, Contact.EMail
List of properties - inherited from AcctSubAttribute
[CustomerRaw(IsKey = true)]

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoiceType.NumberingAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for ARInvoices version of the
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the AR Invoice.
References ARInvoice.docType and ARInvoice.docDate fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in AR Setup and ARInvoice types:
namely ARSetup.invoiceNumberingID - for ARInvoice, ARSetup.adjustmentNumberingID - for ARDebitMemo and ARCreditMemo
ARSetup.finChargeNumberingID - for FinCharges
ARSetup.paymentNumberingID - for CashSale and CashReturn

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice
member.summary: Represents the Accounts Receivable invoices, credit and debit memos, overdue charges and credit write-offs as well as the invoices created in the Sales Orders module (see ). The records of this type are created and edited through the Invoices and Memos (AR.30.10.00) screen (corresponds to the graph). The SO Invoices are created and edited through the Invoices (SO.30.30.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.DontPrint
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document should not be sent to the Customer as a printed document, and thus the system should not include it in the list of documents available for mass-printing.
member.value: Defaults to the value of the setting of the Customer.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.Printed
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document has been printed.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.DontEmail
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document should not be sent to the Customer by email, and thus the system should not include it in the list of documents available for mass-emailing.
member.value: Defaults to the value of the setting of the Customer.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.Emailed
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document has been emailed to the customer.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.PrintInvoice
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the document awaits printing. The field is used in automation steps for the Invoices and Memos (SO303000) form and thus defines participates in determining whether the document is available for processing on the Process Invoices and Memos (SO505000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.EmailInvoice
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the document awaits emailing. The field is used in automation steps for the Invoices and Memos (SO303000) form and thus defines participates in determining whether the document is available for processing on the Process Invoices and Memos (SO505000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.CreditHold
member.summary: When set to true indicates that the document is on credit hold, which means that the credit check failed for the Customer. The document can't be released while it's on credit hold.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.ApprovedCredit
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that credit has been approved for the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.ApprovedCreditAmt
member.summary: The amount of credit approved for the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.ProjectID
member.summary: The identifier of the project associated with the document or the non-project code, which indicates that the document is not related to any particular project.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.PaymentMethodID
member.summary: The identifier of the payment method that is used for the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.PMInstanceID
member.summary: The identifier of the customer payment method (card or account number) associated with the document.
member.value: Defaults according to the settings of the customer payment methods that are specified for the customer associated with the document. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.CashAccountID
member.summary: The identifier of the Cash Account associated with the document.
member.value: Defaults to the Cash Account selected for the Customer Payment Method, or (if the above is unavailable) to the Cash Account selected as the default one for Accounts Receivable in the settings of the Payment Method (see the field).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.IsCCPayment
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document is paid with a credit card.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARInvoice.SetStatusAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute is intended for the status syncronization in the ARInvoice
Namely, it sets a corresponeded string to the Status field, depending
upon Voided, Released, CreditHold, Hold, Sheduled,Released, OpenDoc, PrintInvoice,EmailInvoice
of the ARInvoice
[SetStatus()]

member.summary: The reference number of the related sales order when the document can be associated with only one sales order (which happens when is set to true for the sales order).

member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the Avalara taxes should be included in the document balance calculation (because these taxes will be calculated only during the release process).

member.summary: If true a corresponding proforma document exists thus making this document (or part of it) read-only.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARTax
member.summary: Represents a line-level tax detail of an Accounts Receivable document. The entities of this type cannot be edited directly. Instead, descendants aggregate them to records, which can be edited on the Invoices and Memos (AR301000) and Cash Sales (AR304000) forms (corresponding to the and graphs, recpectively).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARTran
member.summary: Represents a line of an Accounts Receivable invoice or memo. The record contains such information as the inventory item name, price and quantity, line discounts, and tax category. Entities of this type are edited on the Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARTran.tranCost
member.summary: TranCost is calculated as BaseQty * UnitCost for non-stock items and Qty * Unit Cost for stock items. It could also contain a sum of costs of stock and non-stock items (non stock kit with stock components)
