member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARDiscount
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable discount code used to define discount sequences on the Discounts (AR209500) form. The primary function of a discount code is to specify the type and applicability of the discount. For example, a document discount can be applied to specific customers, or a line discount can be applied to specific inventory items. The entities of this type are edited on the Discount Codes (AR209000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountBranch
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain branches, records of this type define specific branches to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Branches tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountCustomer
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain customers, records of this type define specific customers to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Customers tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountCustomerPriceClass
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain customer price classes, records of this type define specific customer price classes to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Customer Price Classes tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountInventoryPriceClass
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain item price classes, records of this type define specific price classes to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Item Price Classes tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountItem
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain inventory items, records of this type define specific items to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Items tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountSequence
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable discount sequence based on a discount code. A discount sequence specifies exactly how the discount is calculated, based on the amount or quantity of the line item, or on the amount of the document. In contrast to discount codes, which simply define discount types, discount sequences based on a given code specify exactly to which specific entities the discount will apply. For example, if a discount code defines a line-level discount applicable to specific inventory items, discount sequences based on it will each define inventory items to which they apply. The entities of this type can be edited on the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.DiscountSite
member.summary: For discount sequences applicable to certain warehouses, records of this type define specific warehouses to which the corresponding sequence applies. The entities of this type can be edited on the Warehouses tab of the Discounts (AR209500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.AR.ARSalesPrice
member.summary: Represents an Accounts Receivable sales price. Depending on the specified price type, a sales price record can define a base price, a price for a given customer, or a price for a certain customer price class. The entities of this type can be edited on the Sales Prices (AR202000) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.UseFinPeriodForAging
member.summary: A boolean value indicating whether financial periods should be used instead of user-defined aging periods. If true, the fields , , and will not be used for aging. Instead, the current (corresponding to the statement/aging date) and the three preceding financial periods will be used.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeDays00
member.summary: An integer value indicating the upper inclusive bound, in days, of the first aging period. For example, if is equal to 7, then the first aging period will correspond to documents that are 1-7 days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeDays01
member.summary: An integer value indicating the upper inclusive bound, in days, of the second aging period. For example, if is equal to 7, and is equal to 14, then the second aging period will correspond to documents that are 8-14 days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeDays02
member.summary: An integer value indicating the upper inclusive bound, in days, of the third non-current aging period. For example, if is equal to 14, and is equal to 21, then the third aging period will correspond to documents that are 15-21 days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.Bucket01LowerInclusiveBound
member.summary: A display-only integer field indicating the lower inclusive bound, in days, of the first aging period.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.Bucket02LowerInclusiveBound
member.summary: A display-only integer field indicating the lower inclusive bound, in days, of the second aging period.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.Bucket03LowerInclusiveBound
member.summary: A display-only integer field indicating the lower inclusive bound, in days, of the third aging period.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.Bucket04LowerExclusiveBound
member.summary: A display-only integer field indicating the lower exclusive bound, in days, of the last aging period (the "over" period).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeMsgCurrent
member.summary: The description of the zeroth (current) aging period, which incorporates documents that are not overdue.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeMsg00
member.summary: The description of the first aging period, which incorporates documents that are from 1 to days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeMsg01
member.summary: The description of the second aging period, which incorporates documents that are from + 1 to days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeMsg02
member.summary: The description of the third aging period that incorporates documents that are from + 1 to days past due.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.ARStatementCycle.AgeMsg03
member.summary: The description of the last aging period that incorporates documents that are over days past due.

Credit control is enabled at the parent level; that is, the group credit verification settings are specified for the parent account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.Customer.StatementCustomerID
member.summary: Identifier of the customer, whose statements include data for this customer.
member.value: When is true, this field holds the ID of the parent customer (if present). When is false, individual statements are prepared and this field is equal to the ID of this customer. Corresponds to the field. The field is populated by a formula, working only in the scope of the Customers (AR303000) form. See "

member.name: P:PX.Objects.AR.Customer.SharedCreditCustomerID

member.value: When is true, this field holds the ID of the parent customer (if present). When is false, credit control is executed individually for this customer and this field is equal to its ID. Also CA bank transactions are edited on the Process Incoming Payments (AR305000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.summary: Transaction amount in the currency of the transaction. When specified together with appropriate value in the field, the rule will be applied only to the transactions with matching amount. In case the is set to "Between", the value in this field is used as a lower bound for transaction amount.

member.summary: Maximum transaction amount in the currency of the transaction, which the rule should match. Used only when the is set to "Between"

member.summary: The transaction code that the rule should match.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.BankTranDescription

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.MatchDescriptionCase
member.summary: Indicates whether the case should be matched when the system attempts to apply the rule.
member.value: When set to true the description of the transactions will be scanned for presence of the specified text with respect to case. Otherwise, the case will be ignored during string comparison. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CABankTranRule.UseDescriptionWildcards
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must treat '*' and '?' characters in the as wildcards ('*' matches 0 or more arbitrary symbols, '?' matches one arbitrary symbol).
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.summary: Identifier of the of the document generated by the rule.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.DynamicValueValidationAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute allows to provide a dynamic validation rules for the field.
The rule is defined as regexp and may be stored in some external field.
In the costructor, one should provide a search method for this rule.

example.code: [DynamicValueValidation(typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.validRegexp, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.DynamicValueValidationAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Ctor
member.param: Must be IBqlSearch returning a validation regexp.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute defines a PXDBStringAttribute with a dynamically created entry mask
Should be used, when the entry mask must be set during a runtime, rather then at compile-time
May be combined with the DynamicValueValidationAttribute

example.code: [PXDBStringWithMask(255, typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.entryMask, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<VendorPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>),IsUnicode = true)]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Length of the string in the database. Passed to PXDBString.
Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXDBStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute
member.summary:
This as a specialized version of PXRSACryptStringAttribute
which allows to define entry mask dynamically. Works identically to the PXDBStringWithMask
and PXRSACryptString attributes - namely providing run-time entry mask definition for the crypted strings.

example.code: [PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute(1028, typeof(Search<PaymentMethodDetail.entryMask, Where<PaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID, Equal<Current<CustomerPaymentMethodDetail.paymentMethodID>>, And<PaymentMethodDetail.detailID, Equal<Current<CustomerPaymentMethodDetail.detailID>>>>>), IsUnicode = true)]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Length of the string in the database. Passed to PXDBString.
Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CA.PXRSACryptStringWithMaskAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Calls the default constructor of the PXDBString
member.param: Must be a IBqlSearch type returning a valid mask expression

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXRSACryptStringWithConditionalAttribute
member.summary: Works very much like PXRSACryptStringAttribute. Encryption is used conditionally, depending on value of EncryptionRequiredField. isEncryptedField is used to store current state of field - encrypted or not.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.PXVendorCustomerSelectorAttribute
member.summary:
Selector. Allows to select either vendors or customers depending
upon the value in the BatchModule field. Will return a list of Customers for AR
and a list of Vendors for AP, other types are not supported. If a currency ID is provided,
list of Vendors/Customers will be restricted by those, having this CuryID set
or having AllowOverrideCury set on. For example this allows to select only Customers/Vendors
which may pay to/from a specific cash account
[PXVendorCustomerSelector(typeof(CABankTran.origModule))]

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj
member.summary: Contains the main properties of CA transactions. CA transaction are edited on the Transactions (CA304000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DocType
member.summary: The type of the cash transaction. Returns the value of the field. This field implements the ICADocument interface member.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.RefNbr
member.summary: The user-friendly unique identifier assigned to the cash transaction in accordance with the numbering sequence. Returns the value of the field. This field implements the ICADocument interface member.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.BranchID
member.summary: The branch of the cash transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.AdjRefNbr
member.summary: The user-friendly unique identifier assigned to the cash transaction in accordance with the numbering sequence. This field is the key field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.AdjTranType
member.summary: The type of the cash transaction. On the Transactions (CA304000) form, transactions of the only Cash Entry type are created.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "CTE": Expense entry, "CAE": Cash entry.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TransferNbr
member.summary: The unique identifier of the cash transfer.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field. The value of the field can be empty. If the value of the field is not empty, this cash transaction is an expense entry ( is "CTE"), which was created on the Funds Transfers (CA301000) form. Then this cash transaction is an expense entry from the form Funds Transfer (CA301000).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.ExtRefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the external document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CashAccountID
member.summary: The cash account that is the source account for the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TranDate
member.summary: The date of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.DrCr
member.summary: The basic type of the transaction: Receipt or Disbursement.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TranDesc
member.summary: The description of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TranPeriodID
member.summary: financial period of the document.
member.value: Is determined by the date of the cash transaction. Unlike the value of this field can't be overridden by a user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.FinPeriodID
member.summary: financial period of the document.
member.value: Defaults to the period to which the belongs, but can be overridden by a user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxZoneID
member.summary: The tax zone that applies to the transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryInfoID
member.summary: The identifier of the exchange rate record for the deposit.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Draft
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the adjustment was created on the Journal Vouchers (GL304000) form and the parent record of the adjustment has the "On Hold" status.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Hold
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the cash transaction is on hold, which means that it can be edited but cannot be released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.RequestApproval
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the cash transaction must be approved before it can be released.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Approved
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction has been approved by a responsible person. This field is displayed if the field is set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Rejected
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction has been rejected by a responsible person. When the transaction has been rejected, its status changes to On Hold.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Released
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction was released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.IsTaxValid
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction's tax is validated by the external tax provider.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.IsTaxPosted
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction's tax is posted or committed to the external tax provider.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.IsTaxSaved
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction's tax is saved in the external tax provider.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.NonTaxable
member.summary: Get or set NonTaxable that mark current document does not impose sales taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryTaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of tax paid on the document in the selected currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of tax paid on the document in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryVatExemptTotal
member.summary: The document total that is exempt from VAT in the selected currency. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the field set to true (that is, the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes (TX205000) form).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.VatExemptTotal
member.summary: The document total that is exempt from VAT in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryVatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The document total that is subjected to VAT in the selected currency. The field is displayed only if the field is set to true (that is, the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box is selected on the Taxes (TX205000) form).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.VatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The document total that is subjected to VAT in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryTaxAmt
member.summary: The tax amount to be paid for the document in the selected currency. This field is enable and visible only if the field and the field are set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxAmt
member.summary: The tax amount to be paid for the document in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CurySplitTotal
member.summary: The sum of amounts of all detail lines in the selected currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.SplitTotal
member.summary: The sum of amounts of all detail lines in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryTranAmt
member.summary: The amount of the transaction in the selected currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TranAmt
member.summary: The amount of the transaction in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryID
member.summary: The currency of the cash transaction.
member.value: Corresponds to the currency of the cash account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryControlAmt
member.summary: The control total of the transaction in the selected currency. A user enters this amount manually. This amount should be equal to the sum of amounts of all detail lines of the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.ControlAmt
member.summary: The control total of the transaction in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.EmployeeID
member.summary: The user who created the cash transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.WorkgroupID
member.summary: The ID of the workgroup which was assigned to approve the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.OwnerID
member.summary: The ID of the employee who was assigned to approve the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.LineCntr
member.summary: The counter of child records. PXParentAttribute of the field refers to this field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TranID
member.summary: The identifier of the transaction that is recorded to the cash account. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Status
member.summary: The status of the cash transaction.
member.value: The field can have one of the values described in .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.EntryTypeID
member.summary: The user-defined transaction type. Selects the appropriate type from the list of entry types defined for the selected cash account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.PaymentsReclassification
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that this transaction is used for payments reclassification.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field of the selected entry type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.Cleared
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the transaction was cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.ClearDate
member.summary: The date when the transaction was cleared.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.tranID_CATran_batchNbr
member.summary: The number of the batch generated to implement the cash transaction. The number appears automatically after the transaction is released.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field. The value is filled in by the method.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.CuryTaxRoundDiff
member.summary: The difference between the original document amount and the rounded amount in the selected currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.TaxRoundDiff
member.summary: The difference between the original document amount and the rounded amount in the base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.HasWithHoldTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that withholding taxes are applied to the document. This is a technical field, which is calculated on the fly and is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.HasUseTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that use taxes are applied to the document. This is a technical field, which is calculated on the fly and is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CAAdj.UsesManualVAT
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the document's tax zone is set up as "Manual VAT Zone". This is a technical field, which is used to restrict the values of the field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CARecon

member.value: Equals the following value: minus .

member.summary: The currency of the cash account.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup

member.summary: The numbering sequence to be used for the identifiers of transfers.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CABatchNumberingID

member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.TransitAcctId

member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.summary: The special multi-currency asset subaccount used (when necessary) as an intermediate account for currency conversions performed during funds transfers.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the Control Total box is added to the Summary area of the Transactions (CA304000) form, so a user can enter the transaction amount manually. This amount will be validated when users enter transactions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequireControlTaxTotal
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the Tax Amount box is added to the Summary area of the Transactions (CA304000) form, so a user can enter the tax amount manually in the transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that newly entered transactions will by default get the On Hold status on entry.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReleaseAP
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that Accounts Payable documents can be released from the Cash Management module. If the value of the field is false, Accounts Payable documents can be released only from the Accounts Payable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReleaseAR
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that Accounts Receivable documents can be released from the Cash Management module. If the value of the field is false, Accounts Receivable documents can be released only from the Accounts Receivable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalDebitUnclearedUnreleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased and uncleared receipts are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalDebitClearedUnreleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased and cleared receipts are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalDebitUnclearedReleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that released and uncleared receipts are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalCreditUnclearedUnreleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased and uncleared disbursements are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalCreditClearedUnreleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased and cleared disbursements are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.CalcBalCreditUnclearedReleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that released and uncleared disbursements are included in calculation of available balances of cash accounts.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AutoPostOption
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that cash transactions are automatically posted to General Ledger on release.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DateRangeDefault
member.summary: The range (starting with the current business date) to be used by default on Cash Management reports: Day, Week, Month, or Financial Period.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequestApproval
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that cash transactions should be approved before they can be released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReceiptTranDaysBefore
member.summary: For the system to categorize a cash transaction as matching, the maximum number of days between the date of a cash transaction (disbursement) and the selected transaction on the bank statement.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ReceiptTranDaysAfter
member.summary: For the system to categorize a cash transaction as matching, the maximum number of days between the date of the selected transaction on the bank statement and the date of a receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DisbursementTranDaysBefore
member.summary: For the system to categorize a cash transaction as matching, the maximum number of days between the date of a cash transaction (receipt) and the selected transaction on the bank statement.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DisbursementTranDaysAfter
member.summary: For the system to categorize a cash transaction as matching, the maximum number of days between the date of the selected transaction on the bank statement and the date of a receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AllowMatchingCreditMemo
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that credit memo are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RefNbrCompareWeight
member.summary: The relative weight of the evaluated difference between the reference numbers of the bank transaction and the cash transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DateCompareWeight
member.summary: The relative weight of the evaluated difference between the dates of the bank transaction and the cash transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.PayeeCompareWeight
member.summary: The relative weight of the evaluated difference between the names of the customer (or vendor) on the bank transaction and the cash transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DateMeanOffset
member.summary: The average number of days for a payment to be cleared with the bank.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.DateSigma
member.summary: The number of days before and after the average delay date during which 50% of payments are generally cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.EmptyRefNbrMatching
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that batch payments with empty ref number are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.IgnoreCuryCheckOnImport
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system ignores the currency check when you import bank statements.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ImportToSingleAccount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that importing a bank statement from a file should be performed to only a specific cash account. The user can import the data only after the user has selected the cash account on the Import Bank Transactions (CA306500) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AllowEmptyFITID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.AllowMatchingToUnreleasedBatch
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that unreleased batch payments are available for matching to bank transactions on the Process Bank Transactions (CA306000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.UnknownPaymentEntryTypeID

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.StatementImportTypeName
member.summary: The service to be used for importing bank statements if the Import Bank Statements to Single Cash Account check box is cleared.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.SkipVoided

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.SkipReconciled
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system skip voided transactions during the reconciliation process if both the original and the voided transactions are registered in the same financial period.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.RequireExtRefNbr

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CA.CASetup.ValidateDataConsistencyOnRelease

member.name: T:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimStatus
member.summary: The current status of the expense claim, which is set by the system. The fields that determine the status of a document are: , , , .
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "H": The claim is a draft and cannot be released. "O": The claim is in the approval process. If the claim is approved, the status changes to Approved. "A": The claim has been approved. "C": The claim has been rejected by the approver. "R": The claim has been released and then an Accounts Payable bill in the employee's name has been generated.

member.summary: The status of the expense claim.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.CuryVatExemptTotal
member.summary: The document total (in the currency of the document) that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes (TX205000) form. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form (which corresponds to the graph). (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.VatExemptTotal
member.summary: The document total (in the base currency of the company) that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the Taxes form. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form (which corresponds to the graph). (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.CuryVatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The document total (in the currency of the document) that is subject to VAT. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form (which corresponds to the graph). The VAT taxable amount is displayed in this box only if the Include in VAT Taxable Total check box is selected for the applicable tax on the Taxes (TX205000) form (which corresponds to the graph). If the check box is cleared, this box will be empty. (Presented in the currency of the document, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.VatTaxableTotal
member.summary: The document total (in the base currency of the company) that is subject to VAT. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form (which corresponds to the graph). The VAT taxable amount is displayed in this box only if the Include in VAT Taxable Total check box is selected for the applicable tax on the Taxes (TX205000) form (which corresponds to the graph). If the check box is cleared, this box will be empty. (Presented in the base currency of the company, see )

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaim.OwnerID
member.summary: The employee responsible for the document approval process.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetailsStatus
member.summary: The current status of the expense receipt, which is set by the system. The fields that determine the status of a document are: , , , .
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "H": The receipt is new and has not been submitted for approval yet, or the receipt has been rejected and then put on hold while a user is adjusting it. "A": The receipt is ready to be added to a claim after it has been approved (if approval is required for the receipt) or after it has been submitted for further processing (if approval is not required). "O": The receipt is pending approval. "C": The receipt has been rejected. "R": The expense claim associated with the receipt has been released.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails
member.summary: Contains the main properties of the expense receipt document, which is a record reflecting that an employee performed a transaction while working for your organization, thus incurring certain expenses. An expense receipt can be edited on the Expense Receipt (EP301020) form (which corresponds to the graph). The list of expense receipts is edited on the Expense Receipts (EP301010) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.ClaimDetailID
member.summary: The identifier of the receipt record in the system, which the system assigns automatically when you save a newly entered receipt. This field is the key field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.ClaimDetailCD
member.summary: The user-friendly unique identifier of the receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.BranchID
member.summary: The company branch that will incur the expenses. If multiple expense receipts associated with different branches are added to one expense claim, the branch specified for the claim on the Financial Details tab of the Expense Claim (EP301000) form (which corresponds to the graph) will reimburse the expenses and the branches specified in this box for the receipts will incur the expenses.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.RefNbr
member.summary: The reference number, which usually matches the number of the original receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.RefNbrNotFiltered
member.summary: The service field that is used in PXFormula for the and fields, which don't need restrictions of original RefNbr in a selector.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.EmployeeID
member.summary: The identifier of the employee who is claiming the expenses.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.OwnerID
member.summary: The employee responsible for the document approval process.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.WorkgroupID
member.summary: The workgroup that is responsible for the document approval process.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.Hold
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the expense receipt has the On Hold status, which means that the receipt can be edited but cannot be added to a claim and released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.Approved
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the expense receipt has been approved by a responsible person and has the Approved status.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.Rejected
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the expense receipt has been rejected by a responsible person. When the receipt is rejected, its status changes to Rejected.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryInfoID
member.summary: The identifier of the CurrencyInfo object associated with the document.
member.value: Is generated automatically and corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryID
member.summary: The code of the currency of the document. By default, the receipt currency is the currency specified as the default for the employee.
member.value: Defaults to the company's base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.ClaimCuryInfoID
member.summary: The code of the currency of the claim in which the current receipt is included.
member.value: Defaults to the company's base currency.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.ExpenseDate
member.summary: The date of the receipt. By default, the current business date is used when a new receipt is created.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryTaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.TaxTotal
member.summary: The total amount of taxes associated with the document in the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryTaxTipTotal
member.summary: A fake field for correct working a Tax attribute. Always must be zero because a tip is tax exempt. The total amount of tips taxes associated with the document in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.TaxTipTotal
member.summary: A fake field for correct working a Tax attribute. Always must be zero because a tip is tax exempt. The total amount of tips taxes associated with the document in the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.ExpenseRefNbr
member.summary: The reference number, which usually matches the number of the original receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.InventoryID
member.summary: The non-stock item of the expense, which determines the financial accounts, the default tax category, and the unit of measure used for the receipt.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: The tax category associated with the expense item.

member.summary: The tax category associated with the tip item.
member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.Qty

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryUnitCost
member.summary: The cost of one unit of the expense item in the currency of the document. If a standard cost is specified for the expense non-stock item, the standard cost is used as the default unit cost.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryEmployeePart
member.summary: The part of the total amount that will not be paid back to the employee in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryExtCost
member.summary: The total amount of the receipt in the currency of the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.CuryTranAmt
member.summary: The amount to be reimbursed to the employee, which is calculated as the difference between the total amount and the employee part in the currency of the document.

member.value: Corresponds to the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.EP.EPExpenseClaimDetails.SalesSubID
member.summary: The corresponding subaccount the system uses to record the amount to charge the customer for. If the Billable check box is selected, the sales subaccount specified for the expense non-stock item is filled in by default. The segments of the sales subaccount are combined according to the settings specified on the Time and Expenses Preferences (EP101000) form.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem
member.summary: Represents Stock Items (have value and stored in a warehouse) and Non-Stock Items (not kept in a warehouse and immediately available for purchase). Whether the item is Stock or Non-Stock is determined by the value of the field. The records of this type are created and edited through the Stock Items (IN.20.25.00) (corresponds to the graph) and the Non-Stock Items (IN.20.20.00) (corresponds to the graph) screens.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryID
member.summary: Database identity. The unique identifier of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InventoryCD
member.summary: Key field. The user-friendly unique identifier of the Inventory Item. The structure of the identifier is determined by the INVENTORY Segmented Key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StkItem
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that this item is a Stock Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Inventory Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemClassID
member.summary: The identifier of the Item Class, to which the Inventory Item belongs. Item Classes provide default settings for items, which belong to them, and are used to group items.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ParentItemClassID
member.summary: The field is used to populate standard settings of Inventory Item from Item Class when it's created On-The-Fly and not yet persisted.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemStatus
member.summary: The status of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "AC" - Active (can be used in inventory operations, such as issues and receipts), "NS" - No Sales (cannot be sold), "NP" - No Purchases (cannot be purchased), "NR" - No Request (cannot be used on requisition requests), "IN" - Inactive, "DE" - Marked for Deletion. Defaults to Active ("AC").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ItemType
member.summary: The type of the Inventory Item.
member.value: Possible values are: "F" - Finished Good (Stock Items only), "M" - Component Part (Stock Items only), "A" - Subassembly (Stock Items only), "N" - Non-Stock Item (a general type of Non-Stock Item), "L" - Labor (Non-Stock Items only), "S" - Service (Non-Stock Items only), "C" - Charge (Non-Stock Items only), "E" - Expense (Non-Stock Items only). Defaults to the Type associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Finished Good ("F") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ValMethod
member.summary: The method used for inventory valuation of the item (Stock Items only).
member.value: Allowed values are: "T" - Standard, "A" - Average, "F" - FIFO, "S" - Specific. Defaults to the Valuation Method associated with the Item Class of the item if it's specified, or to Standard ("T") otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the associated with the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Tax Category associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.TaxCalcMode
member.summary: The tax calculation mode, which defines which amounts (tax-inclusive or tax-exclusive) should be entered in the detail lines of a document. This field is displayed only if the field is set to true.
member.value: The field can have one of the following values: "T" (Tax Settings): The tax amount for the document is calculated according to the settings of the applicable tax or taxes. "G" (Gross): The amount in the document detail line includes a tax or taxes. "N" (Net): The amount in the document detail line does not include taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.WeightItem
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that this item is a Weight Item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the base unit for the Inventory Item.
member.value: Defaults to the Base Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.SalesUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the sales unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the sales unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Sales Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PurchaseUnit
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used as the purchase unit for the Inventory Item. This field can be changed only if the Multiple Units of Measure feature is enabled. Otherwise, the purchase unit is assumed to be the same as the Base Unit.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Unit associated with the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalBaseUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Base Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalSalesUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Sales Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DecimalPurchaseUnit
member.summary:
When set to false, indicates that the system will prevent enter of non-integer values into the quantity field for choosed Purchase Unit value.
Defaults to true

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.Commisionable
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must calculate commission on the sale of this item.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ReasonCodeSubID
member.summary: The identifier of the Suabaccount defined by the Reason Code, associated with this item.
member.value: Defaults to the Reason Code Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.SalesAcctID
member.summary: The income used to record sales of the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Sales Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.SalesSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record sales of the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Sales Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InvtAcctID
member.summary: The asset used to keep the inventory balance, resulting from the transactions with this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the Inventory Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.InvtSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to keep the inventory balance, resulting from the transactions with this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the Inventory Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.COGSAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the cost of goods sold for this item when a sales order for it is released. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the COGS Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.COGSSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the cost of goods sold for this item when a sales order for it is released. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the COGS Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DiscAcctID
member.summary: The used to record discounts for the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Discount Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DiscSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record discounts for the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Discount Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstRevAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences in inventory value of this item estimated by using the pending standard cost and the currently effective standard cost for the quantities on hand. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Revaluation Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstRevSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences in inventory value of this item estimated by using the pending standard cost and the currently effective standard cost for the quantities on hand. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Revaluation Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstVarAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences between the currently effective standard cost and the cost on the inventory receipt of the item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Variance Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCstVarSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences between the currently effective standard cost and the cost on the inventory receipt of the item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under Standard Valuation Method.
member.value: Defaults to the Standard Cost Variance Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PPVAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record the differences between the extended price on the purchase receipt and the extended price on the Accounts Payable bill for this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under any Valuation Method except Standard.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Price Variance Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PPVSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record the differences between the extended price on the purchase receipt and the extended price on the Accounts Payable bill for this item. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) under any Valuation Method except Standard.
member.value: Defaults to the Purchase Price Variance Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.POAccrualAcctID
member.summary: The liability used to accrue amounts on purchase orders related to this item. Applicable for all Stock Items (see ) and for Non-Stock Items, for which a receipt is required.
member.value: Defaults to the PO Accrual Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.POAccrualSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to accrue amounts on purchase orders related to this item. Applicable for all Stock Items (see ) and for Non-Stock Items, for which a receipt is required.
member.value: Defaults to the PO Accrual Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LCVarianceAcctID
member.summary: The expense used to record differences between the landed cost amounts specified on purchase receipts and the amounts on inventory receipts. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the Landed Cost Variance Account set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LCVarianceSubID
member.summary: The Subaccount used to record differences between the landed cost amounts specified on purchase receipts and the amounts on inventory receipts. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to the Landed Cost Variance Sub. set on the Posting Class of the item. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LastSiteID
member.summary: Reserved for internal use.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LastStdCost

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PendingStdCost

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.StdCostDate
member.summary: The date when the Current Cost became effective.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BasePrice
member.summary: The price used as the default price, if there are no other prices defined for this item in any price list in the Accounts Receivable module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseWeight
member.summary: The weight of the Base Unit of the item.
member.value: Given in the default Weight Unit of the Inventory module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseVolume
member.summary: The volume of the item.
member.value: Given in the default Volume Unit of the Inventory module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseItemWeight
member.summary: The weight of the Base Unit of the item.
member.value: Given in the Weight Unit of this item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.BaseItemVolume
member.summary: The volume of the Base Unit of the item.
member.value: Given in the Volume Unit of this item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.WeightUOM
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used for the Weight of the item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.VolumeUOM
member.summary: The Unit of Measure used for the Volume of the item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackSeparately
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the item must be packaged separately from other items. This field is automatically set to true if By Quantity is selected as the PackageOption. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PackageOption
member.summary: The option that governs the system in the process of determining the optimal set of boxes for the item on each sales order. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ).
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Manual, "W" - By Weight (the system will take into account the Max. Weight allowed for each box specififed for the item), "Q" - By Quantity (the system will take into account the Max. Quantity allowed for each box specififed for the item. With this option items of this kind are always packages separately from other items), "V" - By Weight and Volume (the system will take into account the Max. Weight and Max. Volume allowed for each box specififed for the item). Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PreferredVendorID
member.summary: Preferred (default) Vendor for purchases of this item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PreferredVendorLocationID
member.summary: The of the Preferred (default) Vendor.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DefaultSubItemID
member.summary: The default Subitem for this item, which is used when there are no subitems or when specifying subitems is not important. This field is relevant only if the Inventory Subitems feature is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DefaultSubItemOnEntry
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must set the Default Subitem for the lines involving this item by default on data entry forms. This field is relevant only if the Inventory Subitems feature is enabled.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DfltSiteID
member.summary: The default Warehouse used to store the items of this kind. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) and when the Warehouses feature is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Defaults to the Default Warehouse specified for the Class of the item.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DfltShipLocationID
member.summary: The Location of warehouse used by default to issue items of this kind. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) when the Warehouse Locations feature is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DfltReceiptLocationID
member.summary: The Location of warehouse used by default to receive items of this kind. Applicable only for Stock Items (see ) when the Warehouse Locations feature is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ProductWorkgroupID
member.summary: The workgroup that is responsible for the item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.ProductManagerID
member.summary: The product manager responsible for this item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PriceWorkgroupID
member.summary: The workgroup that is responsible for the pricing of this item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PriceManagerID
member.summary: The manager responsible for the pricing of this item.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.NegQty
member.summary: An unbound field that, when equal to true, indicates that negative quantities are allowed for this item.
member.value: The value of this field is taken from the field of the Class, to which the item belongs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LotSerClassID
member.summary: The lot/serial class, to which the item is assigned. This field is relevant only if the Lot/Serial Tracking feature is enabled.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.LotSerNumberResult
member.summary: The Lot/Serial Number generated for the item by the system. The Lot/Serial Numbers are generated by the action of the graph (corresponds to the Stock Items (IN.20.25.00) screen).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PostClassID
member.summary: Identifier of the Posting Class associated with the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Posting Class selected for the item class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.DeferredCode
member.summary: The deferral code used to perform deferrals on sale of the item.
member.value: Defaults to the Deferral Code selected for the Item Class. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.IN.InventoryItem.PriceClassID

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.PMBillEngine.Bill(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String)
member.summary: Run billing procedure for specified project.
member.param: Project ID billing procedure is being run for.
Date invoices should be created on. Procedure finds out the value based on the project data if null.

Financial period invoices should be create in. Procedure finds out the value based on the project data if null. If not null, the value may be treated differently depending on MultipleCalendarsSupport feature. If the feature is turned on, the value is treated as a master calendar financial period. Otherwise, the value is treated as the organization related period.
member.returns: Billing procedure result

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.PMAccountGroup
member.summary: Account Group that is used in the Project Module. Group of GL accounts of the same type. Every GL Account can be included into one and only one group of the same type as the account (Asset, Liability, Income and Expense). It is also possible to create non accounting GL Group, that can be used for collection and trace of any statistical information on the project that is not related to finance. Account groups are used to classify project budget and balance information. Essentially in the scope of project they play the same role as the GL account in terms of GL Ledger. Account groups are mapped to GL accounts to provide transfer and mapping of the project related financial information from the GL module to Project Management Module. Account groups are not mapped to GL accounts one to one to reduce the number of the account groups compare to the number of the natural GL accounts. The other reason is the ability to create non - financial account groups to enter and analyze the information that is not directly linked to finance.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.BaseProjectTaskAttribute
member.summary: Task Selector that displays all Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. When This selector is used in pair with and a Contract is selected Task is no longer mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.SOFreightDetailTask
member.summary:
Task Selector that displays all active Tasks for the given Project. Task Field is Disabled if a Non-Project is selected; otherwise mandatory. Task Selector always work in pair with Project Selector. When the Project Selector displays a valid Project Task field becomes mandatory. If Completed Task is selected an error will be displayed - Completed Task cannot be used in DataEntry.
Task is mandatory only if the Freight amount is greater then zero.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.PMAddressAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Internaly, it expects PMAddress as a IAddress type.
member.param:
Must have type IBqlSelect. This select is used for both selecting
a source Address record from which AR address is defaulted and for selecting default version of POAddress,
created from source Address (having matching ContactID, revision and IsDefaultContact = true)
if it exists - so it must include both records. See example above.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.PMContactAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.Type)
member.summary: Ctor. Internaly, it expects PMContact as a IContact type
member.param:
Must have type IBqlSelect. This select is used for both selecting
a source Contact record from which AR Contact is defaulted and for selecting version of PMContact,
created from source Contact (having matching ContactID, revision and IsDefaultContact = true).
- so it must include both records. See example above.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Defaults ProjectID to the Non-Project if the module supplied is either null or not not intergated with Project Management i.e. PMSetup.VisibleInXX = False. When Search is supplied ProjectID is defaulted with the value returned by that search. Selector also contains static Util methods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute.ForceProjectExplicitly
member.summary: Forces user to explicitly set the Project irrespective of the AccountType settings.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute.IsAccountGroupSpecified(PX.Data.PXCache,System.Object)
member.summary: When Account has no AccountGroup associated with it the only valid value for the Project is a Non-Project.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute.NonProject
member.summary: Returns the Non-Project ID. Non-Project is stored in the table as a row with =1.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.ProjectDefaultAttribute.IsNonProject(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns true if the given ID is a Non-Project ID; oterwise false.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.POProjectDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Project Default Attribute specific for PO Module. Defaulting of ProjectID field in PO depends on the LineType. If Line type is of type Non-Stock, Freight or Service ProjectID is defaulted depending on the setting in PMSetup (same as ). For all other type of lines Project is defaulted with Non-Project.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.GLProjectDefaultAttribute
member.summary: Project Default Attribute specific for GL Module. Defaulting of ProjectID field in GL depends on the Ledger type. Budget and Report Ledgers do not require Project and hense it is always defaulted with Non-Project for these ledgers.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PM.RateEngine
member.summary: Rate Engine. Calculates @Rate to be used in the Allocation based on the Rate Tables and the attributes of a given transaction.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RateEngine.GetRate(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for Rate based on RateCode, PriceClass and Transaction properties. Rate is first searched for the given PriceClass; if not found it is then searched in BasePriceClass.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RegisterReleaseProcess.GetTransByBranchAndFinPeriod(PX.Objects.PM.PMRegister)
member.summary: The key of the dictionary is a BranchID.FinPeriodID key.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RegisterReleaseProcess.AddToUnbilledSummary(PX.Data.PXGraph,PX.Objects.PM.PMTran)
member.summary: Increases the counter of unbilled transactions. Billed and Reversed transactions are ignored. Note: Although the method will add all necessary caches to the views collection of the graph to be saved on persist. This will work only if the graph is persisted within the context of current request. If there will be graph load/unload between this call and the Persist please add the required Caches to the graph manualy.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PM.RegisterReleaseProcess.SubtractFromUnbilledSummary(PX.Data.PXGraph,PX.Objects.PM.PMTran)
member.summary: Decreases the counter of unbilled transactions. Only Billed or Reversed transactions are processed. Note: Although the method will add all necessary caches to the views collection of the graph to be saved on persist. This will work only if the graph is persisted within the context of current request. If there will be graph load/unload between this call and the Persist please add the required Caches to the graph manualy.

member.summary: The purpose of this handler is to workaround situations where exception was thrown in RowUpdated event chain and formulas that are embedded inside SOTaxAttribute will fail to calculate totals. Resetting totals to null will force formulas to calculate on all the details rather then calculate on the difference from previous incorrect result.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.PO.NumberingAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized version of the AutoNumber attribute for POOrders
It defines how the new numbers are generated for the PO Order.
References POOrder.docType and POOrder.docDate fields of the document,
and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in PO Setup and POOrder types:
namely POSetup.regularPONumberingID, POSetup.regularPONumberingID for POOrderType.RegularOrder, POOrderType.DropShip, and POOrderType.StandardBlanket,
and POSetup.standardPONumberingID for POOrderType.Blanket and POOrderType.Transfer

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized PXStringList attribute for PO Order Line types.
Provides a list of possible values for line types depending upon InventoryID
specified in the row. For stock- and not-stock inventory items the allowed values
are different. If item is changed and old value is not compatible with inventory item
- it will defaulted to the applicable value.
[POLineTypeList(typeof(POLine.inventoryID))]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Ctor, short version. List of allowed values is defined as POLineType.GoodsForInventory, POLineType.NonStock, POLineType.Service, POLineType.Freight, POLineType.Description
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field in the row

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Ctor. Shorter version. User may define a list of allowed values and their descriptions List for hidden values is defined as POLineType.GoodsForInventory, POLineType.GoodsForSalesOrder, POLineType.GoodsForReplenishment, POLineType.GoodsForDropShip, POLineType.NonStockForDropShip, POLineType.NonStockForSalesOrder, POLineType.NonStock, POLineType.Service, POLineType.Freight, POLineType.Description - it includes all the values for the POLine types.
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field in the row
List of allowed values labels. Will be shown in the combo-box in UI

member.name: M:PX.Objects.PO.POLineTypeListAttribute.#ctor(System.Type,System.String[],System.String[],System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Ctor. Full version. User may define a list of allowed values and their descriptions, and a list of hidden values.
member.param: Must be IBqlField. Represents an InventoryID field of the row
Labels for the allowed values. List should have the same size as the list of the values
List of possible values for the control. Must include all the values from the allowedValues list
Labels for the possible values. List should have the same size as the list of the values

member.name: T:PX.Objects.PO.POLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for POLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noPurchase and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to VPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[POLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Extensions.SalesTax.TaxBaseGraph`2.GetDocumentMapping
member.summary: Returns the mapping of the mapped cache extension to a DAC. This method must be overridden in the implementation class of the base graph.
member.remarks: In the implementation graph for a particular graph, you can either return the default mapping or override the default mapping in this method.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following code shows the method that overrides the GetDocumentMapping() method in the implementation class. The method overrides the default mapping of the %Document% mapped cache extension to a DAC: For the CROpportunity DAC, mapping of three fields of the mapped cache extension is overridden.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Extensions.SalesTax.TaxBaseGraph`2.GetDetailMapping
member.summary: Returns the mapping of the mapped cache extension to a DAC. This method must be overridden in the implementation class of the base graph.
member.remarks: In the implementation graph for a particular graph, you can either return the default mapping or override the default mapping in this method.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following code shows the method that overrides the GetDetailMapping() method in the implementation class. The method overrides the default mapping of the %Detail% mapped cache extension to a DAC: For the CROpportunityProducts DAC, the CuryTranAmt field of the mapped cache extension is mapped to the curyAmount of the DAC; other fields of the extension are mapped by default.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Extensions.SalesTax.TaxBaseGraph`2.GetTaxDetailMapping
member.summary: Returns the mapping of the mapped cache extension to a DAC. This method must be overridden in the implementation class of the base graph.
member.remarks: In the implementation graph for a particular graph, you can either return the default mapping or override the default mapping in this method.

code.title: Example
code.description: The following code shows the method that overrides the GetTaxDetailMapping() method in the implementation class. The method returns the defaul mapping of the %TaxDetail% mapped cache extension to the CROpportunityTax DAC.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.Extensions.SalesTax.TaxBaseGraph`2.GetTaxTotalMapping
member.summary: Returns the mapping of the mapped cache extension to a DAC. This method must be overridden in the implementation class of the base graph.
member.remarks: In the implementation graph for a particular graph, you can either return the default mapping or override the default mapping in this method.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.Currency
member.summary: Stores financial settings associated with currencies, thus complementing the DAC type. While holds only general information, such as code and precision, the DAC provides information on all accounts and subaccounts associated with a particular currency, such as the Realized Gain and Loss account and subaccount. The DAC also exposes fields with general currency information (such as ), which are mapped to the corresponding fields in the DAC by means of . The records of this type (as well as the records) are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).
