member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo
member.summary: Stores currency and exchange rate information for a particular document or transaction. Usually, there is an individual record of this type for each document or transaction that involves monetary amounts and supports multi-currency. The documents store a link to their instance of CurrencyInfo in the CuryInfoID field, such as . The exchange rate data for objects of this type is either entered by user or obtained from the records. Records of this type are either created automatically by the or explicitly inserted by the application code (such as in ). User must not be aware of existence of these records.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryInfoID
member.summary: Key field. Database identity. Unique identifier of the Currency Info object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.ModuleCode
P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.IsReadOnly
member.summary: When set to true, the system won't allow user to change the fields of this object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BaseCalc
member.summary: When true, indicates that the system must calculate the amounts in the base currency for the related document or transaction. Otherwise the changes in the amounts expressed in the currency of the document won't result in an update to the amounts in base currency.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BaseCuryID
member.summary: Identifier of the base .
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryID
member.summary: Identifier of the of this Currency Info object.
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.DisplayCuryID
member.summary: The read-only property providing the Currency for display in the User Interface.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryRateTypeID
member.summary: The identifier of the Rate Type associated with this object.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryEffDate
member.summary: The date, starting from which the specified rate is considered current.
member.value: Defaults to the current business date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryMultDiv
member.summary: The operation required for currency conversion: Divide or Multiply.
member.value: Allowed values are: "M" - Multiply, "D" - Divide. Defaults to "M".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryRate
member.summary: The currency rate. For the purposes of conversion the value of this field is used together with the operation selected in the field.
member.value: Defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.RecipRate
member.summary: The inverse of the exchange rate, which is calculated automatically.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.SampleCuryRate
member.summary: The exchange rate used for calculations and determined by the values of the , and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.SampleRecipRate
member.summary: The inverse of the . This value is also determined by the values of the , and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.CuryPrecision
member.summary: The number of digits after the decimal point used in operations with the amounts associated with this Currency Info object and expressed in its currency.
member.value: The value of this field is taken from the field of the record associated with the currency of this object.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyInfo.BasePrecision
member.summary: The number of digits after the decimal point used in operations with the amounts associated with this Currency Info object and expressed in its base currency.
member.value: The value of this field is taken from the field of the record associated with the base currency of this object.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyList
member.summary: Contains general properties of the currencies that are stored in the system and are used during registration of documents across all modules. The DAC provides such information as code, description, and precision, which are required for amounts given in a particular currency. Financial settings associated with the currency (such as various accounts and subaccounts) are stored separately in the records of the type. Records of this type are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType
member.summary: Represents the types of currency rates, which can be used to distinguish rates by their sources and by the accounting routines the rates are used for. The records of this type are edited on the Currency Rate Types (CM201000) form (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType.CuryRateTypeID
member.summary: Key field. The unique identifier of the rate type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType.Descr
member.summary: The description of the rate type.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType.RateEffDays
member.summary: The number of days, during which the rate of this type is considered current.
member.value: Defaults to 0, meaning that the rate remains effective until the date when a new rate is specified.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType.RefreshOnline
member.summary: Identifies that this currency rate should be automatically refreshed online.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CM.Extensions.CurrencyRateType.OnlineRateAdjustment
member.summary: Adjustment percentage to apply to the rate retrieved online.
member.value: Defaults to 0.00, meaning that the rate actual exchange rate will be used without any adjustment.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyList
member.summary: Contains general properties of the currencies that are stored in the system and are used during registration of documents across all modules. The DAC provides such information as code, description, and precision, which are required for amounts given in a particular currency. Financial settings associated with the currency (such as various accounts and subaccounts) are stored separately in the records of the type. Records of this type are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: M:PX.Objects.CM.RefreshCurrencyRates.GetUtcSyncDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Helper method to decide if the user wants the relevant currency rates on a particular UTC date, or just the "freshest" currency rates - in the latter case, we need to add the UTC offset to the date given to avoid currency server error.
member.param: The date that the user wants to obtain the currency rates on.

member.summary: A non-mapped temporary DAC used to implement the Refresh Currency Rates form (CM507000) and process (). The records of this type are generated in the view based on the and records. While holds only general information, such as code and precision, the DAC provides information on all accounts and subaccounts associated with a particular currency, such as the Realized Gain and Loss account and subaccount. The DAC also exposes fields with general currency information (such as ), which are mapped to the corresponding fields in the DAC by means of . The records of this type (as well as the records) are edited on the Currencies (CM202000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.CurrencyInfo
member.summary: Stores currency and exchange rate information for a particular document or transaction. Usually, there is an individual record of this type for each document or transaction that involves monetary amounts and supports multi-currency. The documents store a link to their instance of CurrencyInfo in the CuryInfoID field, such as . The exchange rate data for objects of this type is either entered by user or obtained from the records. Records of this type are either created automatically by the or explicitly inserted by the application code (such as in ). User must not be aware of existence of these records.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslationHistory
member.summary: Represents currency translation history. The records of this type are created together with details () by the currency translation process (). The header records store general results of the currency translation, including the dates, status, link to the resulting batch, and totals.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CM.TranslationHistoryDetails
member.summary: Represents the details of the currency translation history. The records of this type are created together with the header () by the currency translation process (). The detail records store the results of currency translation for a particular account and subaccount, including the currency and rate information, link to the resulting GL transaction, status, and amounts.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Accounts Payable module. When false, the period is active in AP.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinPeriods.TableDefinition.FinPeriod.ARClosed
member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Accounts Receivable module. When false, the period is active in AR.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Inventory module. When false, the period is active in IN.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Cash Management module. When false, the period is active in CA.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Fixed Assets module. When false, the period is active in FA.

member.summary: Indicates whether the period is closed in the Payroll module. When false, the period is active in PR. This field is relevant only if the Payroll feature is enabled.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree
member.summary:
Represents a node in the template budget structure. The structure defines the tree of budget articles and is used when articles are preloaded into a new budget (see ). Records of this type don't maintain any budget amounts and are used only to define the structure of a budget, which, however, can be altered in any budget for a particular ledger, branch and year.
The class is used for both group (see ) and leaf nodes. To maintain tree structure, the class stores a link to the parent node in the field.
Records of this type are created on the Budget Configuration (GL205000) form (see the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.GroupID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the budget tree node.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.ParentGroupID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent budget tree node.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value is equal to for the nodes on the first level of the tree.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.SortOrder
member.summary: An integer field that defines the order in which budget tree nodes that belong to one parent appear relative to each other. The value of this field is changed by users when they move budget tree nodes by using the corresponding actions on the Budget Configuration (GL205000) form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.IsGroup
member.summary: The identifier of the GL account of the budget tree node.
member.value: The value of the field can be empty for the group nodes(see).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.AccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the GL of the budget tree node. May be empty for the group (see ) nodes.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.Description
member.summary: The description of the budget tree node.
member.value: Defaults to the description of the account, but can be overwritten by a user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.SubID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL subaccount of the budget tree node.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of the field can be empty for the group (see ) nodes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.AccountMask
member.summary: For a group node (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget tree nodes by their accounts. The selector on the field of the child nodes allows only accounts, whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.SubMask
member.summary: For a group node (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget tree nodes by their subaccounts. The selector on the field of the child nodes allows only subaccounts, whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.Secured
member.summary: An unbound field that indicates (if set to true) that access to the budget tree node is restricted, because the node is included into a restriction group or groups.
member.value: This field is populated only in the context of the Budget Configuration (GL205000) form ().

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.GroupMask
member.summary: The group mask showing which restriction groups the budget tree node belongs to. To learn more about the way restriction groups are managed, see the documentation for the GL Account Access (GL104000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetTree.Included
member.summary: An unbound field that is used in the user interface to include the budget tree node into a restriction group. Also see .

GL Vouchers are edited on derivative forms of following forms: Journal Transactions (GL301000) form (which corresponds to and graphs), Transactions (CA304000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Checks and Payments (AP302000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Quick Checks (AP304000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Payments and Applications (AR302000) form (which corresponds to the graph), Cash Sales (AR304000) form (which corresponds to the graph).

The code is selected by user on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( field) when entering the lines of the batch and determines the module and type of the document or transaction to be created from the corresponding line of the document batch. Identifies the record of this DAC associated with a line of a document batch. Only one code can be created for any combination of and Document/Transaction Type.

member.summary: The identifier of the branch to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.LedgerID
member.summary: The identifier of the ledger to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.FinYear
member.summary: The financial year to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.GroupID
member.summary: The identifier of the budget article. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field of the master record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.AccountID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL account of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of this field is inherited from the field of the master record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.SubID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL subaccount of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of this field is inherited from the field of the master record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.FinPeriodID
member.summary: The identifier of the financial period, which is represented by the record. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.Amount
member.summary: The amount allocated to the specified financial period.
member.value: The value is specified by a user or assigned by one of the procedures that distribute budgeted amounts. The values of these fields of detail lines are summed up to the field of the master record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLineDetail.ReleasedAmount
member.summary: The currently released amount for the specified financial period.
member.value: This field is updated with the value of the field upon release of the corresponding budget article. The difference between the value of this field and the field shows the difference between the current state of the article and the corresponding figures in the budget ledger.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine
member.summary:
Represents a budget article. The class is used for both group (see ) and leaf articles. To maintain tree structure, the class stores a link to the parent budget article in the field.
The budget article holds the amount allocated to a particular account-subaccount pair (or a group of accounts and subaccounts, such as ) for a particular year. Distribution of this amount between the periods of the year is stored in the corresponding records.
Records of this type are created on the Budgets (GL302010) form (see the graph) either manually or by the preload mechanism that creates GLBudgetLine from records."/>

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.GroupID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the budget article. This field is a part of the compound key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.ParentGroupID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent budget article. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field of the parent. The value is equal to for the nodes on the first level of the tree.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.IsGroup
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article represents a group of other articles. That is, the article has child articles, which are linked to this article by their field.

members.member: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article was created from a budget tree configuration node by the budget tree preload process. (The preload process is invoked when a user creates a budget for a new year (see ) or converts an existing budget (see ).)

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.BranchID
member.summary: The identifier of the branch to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.LedgerID
member.summary: The identifier of the ledger to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.FinYear
member.summary: The financial year to which the budget article belongs. This field is a part of the compound key.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AccountID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL account of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The value of the field can be empty for the group articles (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SubID
member.summary: The identifier of the GL subaccount of the budget article.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Can be empty for the group articles (see ).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Description
member.summary: The description of the budget article.
member.value: Defaults to the description of the account, but can be overwritten by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Amount
member.summary: The amount that is budgeted for the article for a particular year.
member.value: The value can be edited by a user and indicates the decision to allocate the specified amount to the particular budget article. After the article is released, the amount can still be edited. If the amount is changed, the article will be marked as unreleased (see ) and can be released again, which will result in updating the budget ledger figures to match the current state of the article.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AllocatedAmount
member.summary: The total amount of the budget article distributed between the periods of the year.
member.value: The value of this field is calculated as a sum of amounts of the detail lines of the budget article (see ) and cannot be edited by a user. A budget article cannot be released until its and are equal to each other.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.ReleasedAmount
member.summary: The currently released amount of the article, which matches the figures in the budget ledger.
member.value: This field is updated with the value of the field upon release of the budget article. The difference between the values of this field and the field shows the difference between the current state of the article and the corresponding figures in the budget ledger.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.AccountMask
member.summary: For a group article (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget articles by their accounts. The selector on the field of the child articles allows only accounts whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SubMask
member.summary: For a group article (see ), defines the mask for selection of the child budget articles by their subaccounts. The selector on the field of the child articles allows only subaccounts whose matches the specified mask.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Released
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the budget article has been released at least once. A released article can be released again if its is not equal to its .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.WasReleased
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the article was released at least once. Different from in that the latter will be reset to false upon edits of a released article, while this field will still be true even if the article can be released again.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.GroupMask
member.summary: The group mask showing which restriction groups the budget article belongs to. The value of this field is inherited from the group mask of the corresponding budget tree node, because access to budgets is managed through the budget tree configuration.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.TreeSortOrder
member.summary: An integer field that defines the order in which group budget articles (see ) that belong to one parent appear relative to each other in the tree view.
member.value: The value of this field is automatically assigned during budget tree preload from of the corresponding tree node.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.SortOrder
member.summary: The internal field that defines the order in which non-group budget articles appear relative to each other.
member.value: This field is populated only in the graph and is not stored in the database.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLBudgetLine.Cleared
member.summary: The field is reserved for internal use.

member.summary: The type of the document or transaction generated according to the code.
member.value: Allowed values set depends on the selected .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTranCode.TranCode
member.summary: !REV! The unique voucher code for the selected and Type of the document. The code is selected by user on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( field) when entering the lines of the batch and determines the module and type of the document or transaction to be created from the corresponding line of the document batch. Identifies the record of this DAC associated with a line of a document batch. Only one code can be created for any combination of and Document/Transaction Type.

member.summary: Indicates whether the entry code is active. Only active codes can be used to create documents or transactions.
member.value: Defaults to true. If set to false, the entry code won't appear in the list of available codes for the field.

For the lines used to create AP or AR documents the account is selected automatically once the vendor or customer is chosen. member.value: Allowed values are: "S" - Summary (transactions amounts are summarized for each account and subaccount pair), "D" - Details (each transaction from other module results in a journal transaction. Defaults to "D" - Detail.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLHistoryByPeriod
member.summary: The DAC used to simplify selection and aggregation of proper records on various inquiry and processing screens of the General Ledger module. The main purpose of this DAC is to close the gaps in GL history records, which appear in case GL history records do not exist for every financial period defined in the system. To close these gaps, this projection DAC calculates the last activity period for every existing financial period, so that inquiries and reports that produce information for a given financial period can look at the latest available record.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.BatchModule.GetDisplayName(System.String)

example.code: BatchModule.GetDisplayName("GL"); // returns "General Ledger"

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.Batch
member.summary: Represents a batch of journal transactions. The records of this type are edited through the Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen (corresponds to the graph). GL batches are also created whenever a document that needs posting to GL is released in any other module.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Selected
member.summary: Indicates whether the record is selected for mass processing.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BranchID
member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Module
member.summary: Key field. The code of the module, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Allowed values are: "GL", "AP", "AR", "CM", "CA", "IN", "DR", "FA", "PM", "TX", "SO", "PO".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchNbr
member.summary: Key field. Auto-generated unique number of the batch.
member.value: The number is generated from the Numbering Sequence specified in the setup record of the , to which the batch belongs. For example, the numbering sequence for the batches belonging to the General Ledger module is specified in the field. For other modules see corresponding setup DACs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LedgerID
member.summary: Identifier of the , to which the batch belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.DateEntered
member.summary: The date of the batch, specified by user.
member.value: Defaults to the current Business Date.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.FinPeriodID
member.summary: Identifier of the Financial Period, to which the batch belongs.
member.value: By default the period is deducted from the date of the batch. Can be overriden by user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.BatchType
member.summary: The type of the batch.
member.value: Allowed values are: "H" - Normal, "R" - Recurring, "C" - Consolidation, "T" - Trial Balance, "RCL" - Reclassification, "A" - Allocation. Defaults to "H" - Normal.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NumberCode
member.summary: The identifier of the record used to assign an auto-generated to the batch.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. The number codes are assigned by the and graphs, which allows to have separate numbering sequences for recurring and allocation batches.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.RefNbr
member.summary: Auto-generated reference number assigned to the batch according to the Numbering Sequence specified in the field of the corresponding record (see the field).
member.value: The field will remain empty if is not set for the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Status
member.summary: The read-only status of the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the , , , and fields. Possible values are: "H" - Hold "B" - Balanced "U" - Unposted "P" - Posted "C" - Completed "V" - Voided "R" - Released "Q" - Partially Released "S" - Scheduled

The control total of the batch in its currency.

member.summary: Identifier of the CurrencyInfo record associated with the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverse
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is auto-reversing. For a batch of this kind the system automatically generates a reversing batch in the next period. The reversing batch is generated either when the original batch is posted or when it is released, depending on the value of the field of the GL preferences record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.AutoReverseCopy
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the batch is a reversing batch. See also the and fields.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch) belongs.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.OrigBatchNbr
member.summary: The number of the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by this batch).
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Released
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been released.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Posted
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.RequirePost
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch is required to be posted.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.PostErrorCount
member.summary: Indicates how many times system has failed while posting batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Draft
member.summary: When set to true, indicates the the batch is a draft. The drafts of batches are not displayed in the Journal Transactions screen.
member.value: This field is set to true by the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) screen ( graph) when a new defining a transactions batch is created. This allows to reserve a number for the batch, while not showing it in the interface until the is released and the batch is actually created. Outside Journal Vouchers defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.LineCntr
member.summary: The counter of the document lines, used internally to assign consistent numbers to newly created lines. It is not recommended to rely on this field to determine the exact count of lines, because it might not reflect the latter under some conditions.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CuryID
member.summary: The code of the Currency of the batch.
member.value: Defaults to the base currency of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ScheduleID
member.summary: Identifier of the , associated with the batch.
member.value: If is true for the batch, then this field provides the identifier of the schedule, into which the batch is included as a template. Otherwise, the field is set to the identifier of the schedule that produced the batch. Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Hold
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch is on hold.
member.value: Defaults to true, if the flag is set in the preferences of the module, and to false otherwise.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Scheduled
member.summary: When true, indicates that the batch is included as a template into a pointed to by the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Voided
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch has been voided.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.Description
member.summary: The description of the batch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.CreateTaxTrans
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must generate tax transactions for the batch.
member.value: This field is taken into account only if the feature is on. Affects only those batches, which belong to the General Ledger . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.SkipTaxValidation
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system should not validate the tax transactions associated with the batch.
member.value: The value of this field is relevant only if is true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.ReverseCount
member.summary: The read-only field, reflecting the number of batches in the system, which reverse this batch.
member.value: This field is populated only by the graph (corresponds to the Journal Transactions GL.30.10.00 screen).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Batch.HasRamainingAmount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the batch has a detail with the visible field.
member.value: This field is populated only by the graph (corresponds to the Journal Transactions GL.30.10.00 screen).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.Company
member.summary: Provides access to the settings of the company. The information related to the company is edited through the Branches (CS.10.20.00) screen (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.CompanyCD
member.summary: Unique user-friendly identifier of the Company.
member.value: Corresponds to the field of the associated Business Account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.BaseCuryID
member.summary: The base of the company.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.Company.PhoneMask
member.summary: The mask used to display phone numbers for all branches of the company.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup
member.summary: Provides access to the preferences of the General Ledger module. Can be edited by user through the General Ledger Preferences (GL.10.20.00) screen.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.YtdNetIncAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Year-to-Date Net Income . The account tracks net income accumulated since the beginning of the financial year. It is updated by every transaction posted in the system. The account must not be changed after any journal transactions have been posted.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. Only Accounts of type Liability ("L") can be specified as YTD Net Income account.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RetEarnAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the Retained Earnings . The account is updated by the amount accumulated on the YTD Net Income account during the financial year closing.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevOption
member.summary: Determines when the system generates reversing batches.
member.value: Possible values are: "P" - On Post and "C" - On Period Closing. Default value is On Post.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoRevEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system creates negative entries when reversing a . If set to true, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the Debit/Credit amounts of the original transactions, but with opposite signs. If set to false, the transactions of the reversing batch will retain the sign of the original amounts, but will have them on the opposite sides of Debit/Credit.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AutoPostOption
member.summary: Determines whether the system must automatically post Batches once they are released. When this option is set to true there won't be any batches with status Unposted in the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.COAOrder
member.summary: Determines the order of Accounts in the reports of the General Ledger module.
member.value: Allowed values are: 0 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income and Expenses 1 - 1.Assets, 2.Liabilities, 3.Income, 4.Expenses 2 - 1.Income, 2. Expenses, 3. Assets, 4.Liabilities 3 - 1.Income and Expenses, 2. Assets, 3.Liabilities 128 - Custom order. If the last option is selected, the order of accounts is determined by the COAOrder field of the individual Accounts. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireControlTotal
member.summary: Indicates whether the system must enforce validation of batch control totals on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen.
member.value: When set to true the control total and debit/credit total of batches must match and user won't be able to save the batch until this condition is met. Otherwise, validation is performed only after clearing the Hold flag on the Batch. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.RequireRefNbrForTaxEntry
member.summary: Indicates whether the Reference Number fields are required on Journal Transactions (GL.30.10.00) screen in case of entering Gl transactions with taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PostClosedPeriods
member.summary: Determines whether the system allows to post transactions to closed Financial Periods. If set to false, the system raises an error on attempts to enter or post transactions into a closed period.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.BatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DocBatchNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for batches of documents created using the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TBImportNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for imports of trial balances. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.AllocationNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for allocations. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ScheduleNumberingID
member.summary: The identifier of the Numbering Sequence used for schedules. See the DAC.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.HoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new batches.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.VouchersHoldEntry
member.summary: Determines whether the system must set the Hold flag and Status On Hold when creating new vouchers.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ConsolSegmentId
member.summary: The identifier of the Segment of the Subaccount segmented key, whose values denote the consolidation unit in the subaccounts of the parent company. Controls the selector on the field.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.PerRetainTran
member.summary: Determines the number of periods the system will keep the transactions in the database.
member.value: Defaults to 99.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.DefaultSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the Subaccount to be used as the default one with Accounts, which have the NoSubDetail field set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.TrialBalanceSign
member.summary: Determines whether the system should automatically change the sign of the trial balance when importing data. Also affects the way trial balance is displayed on reports and inquiries.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Normal - the system doesn't change the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts are grouped by account type. "R" - Reversed - the system reverses the signs of balances of expense and income accounts on import. On reports and inquiries all the accounts except for the Year-to-Date Net Income account are listed. Defaults to "N".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLSetup.ReuseRefNbrsInVouchers
member.summary: Determines whether the reference numbers for documents created on the Journal Vouchers (GL.30.40.00) form) are reused in case the number was allocated for the document that was not persisted, or the document was deleted thus freeing the reference number. When set to true, the system will pick up the free numbers from such documents when creating new entries on the mentioned form. (Note: this may lead to non-linear numbering.) Otherwise the form will always assign new numbers to the documents even if there are reusable ones.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.NonBillable
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the transaction is non-billable in the Project This means that when releasing the batch the system will set the field of the project transaction generated from this transaction to false. This field is relevant only if the Projects module has been activated and integrated with the General Ledger module.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.IsInterCompany
member.summary: When true, indicates that the transaction is an inter-branch transaction.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.SummPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must summarize the transaction with other ones when posting. In this case all transactions being posted are grouped by Account and Subaccount. Then, the amounts are summarized and a single transaction is created for each group.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.ZeroPost
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must post the transaction even if its amounts are equal to zero.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigModule
member.summary: The module, to which the original batch (e.g. the one reversed by the parent batch of this transaction) belongs.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.OrigAccountID
member.summary: Identifier of the associated with the original document. This field is populated for the transactions updating the account, which is different from the account of the original document. For example, if upon release of an Accounts Receivable document an RGOL account must be updated, the system will generate a transaction with set to the RGOL account and set to the Accounts Receivable account associated with the document being released.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.summary: The type of the original document or transaction. This field is populated when a document is released in another module, such as Accounts Receivable or Accounts Payable. For example, when an ARInvoice is released, the system will set this field for the resulting transactions to the document's DocType.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.GLTran.TranClass

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.JournalEntry.created
member.summary:
The collection of batches created during the current long-running operation. The collection serves the following two purposes: 1. If the feature is activated, the collection stores the list of batches to which transactions can be added during the current operation. 2. If the setting is activated, the collection stores the list of batches that should be posted after release.
!!!WARNING!!! If persisting of some was interrupted by some reason, this collection may store inconsistent state of .

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.JournalEntry.CleanupCreated(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{System.Int32})
member.summary: Removes the last elements of the collection corresponding to GL batches that failed to persist. The absence of the batch index in the dictionary is used as a criterion. This method should be called each time the transaction scope is rolled back, immediately after it is rolled back.

member.name: M:PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.UpdateHistory(PX.Objects.GL.GLTran,PX.Objects.GL.Account,System.String,PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.HistoryUpdateAmountType,PX.Objects.GL.PostGraph.HistoryUpdateMode)
member.summary: This method will return without executing if returns false.

summary.para: If we validate records from the first period of the year, the validation year's retained earnings beginning balance will be deleted by validation process and needs to be restored from the previous year's accumulated net income.

In addition to that, customers who upgrade from legacy Acumatica versions without the 's automatic year closing (see ), this method ensures that even if the customer starts GL validation immediately after upgrade, the year preceding the validation period is closed.

Used during GL integrity check procedure. By inserting relevant zero records with = false, this function ensures the transfer of the previous period's Net Income amounts to the retained earnings beginning balance of the subsequent year by the query inside .

If we validate records from the second or later period of the year, the following year's retained earnings beginning balance will not be calculated completely by during processing, and we also need to transfer the accumulated net income from the previous period.

summary.param: The latest period of the financial year from which the accumulated net income amounts should be transferred to the next year's beginning RE balances by 's year closing query.

member.summary: Obsolete field. The length of periods of the year in days.

member.summary: The type of financial periods that make up the year.
member.value: Allowed values are: "MO" - Month, "BM" - Two Months, "QR" - Quarter, "WK" - Week, "BW" - Two Weeks, "FW" - Four Weeks, "DC" - Decade, "FF" - 4-4-5 Weeks, "FI" - 4-5-4 Weeks, "IF" - 5-4-4 Weeks, "CL" - Customer Periods Length, "CN" - Custom Number of Periods.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.UserDefined
member.summary: The read-only field indicating whether the periods of the year can be modified by user.
member.value: Depends on the value of the field - returns true if the is "CN" (Custom number of periods).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.PeriodsStartDate
member.summary: The start date of the first period of the year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.HasAdjustmentPeriod
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system generates an additional period for posting adjustments. The adjustment period has the same start and end date and is the last period of the year. No date in the year corresponds to the adjustment period, so it can be selected for a particular document or batch only manually. See also the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearCalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to determine the end date of a year with week-long periods.
member.value: Available values are: "CA" - Last day of the financial year, "LD" - Include last selected day of week of the year, "ND" - Include selected day of week, nearest tot the end of the year. For more information on these options see the documentation for the Financial Year (GL.10.10.00) page of the system.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.EndYearDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week when period starts. Relevant only for the period types based on weeks.
member.value: Allowed values are: 1 - "Sunday", 2 - "Monday", 3 - "Tuesday", 4 - "Wednesday", 5 - "Thursday", 6 - "Friday", 7 - "Saturday".

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.YearLastDayOfWeek
member.summary: The day of the week of the last day of the financial year. Relevant ony for the period types based on weeks and if the is not "CA" - Last day of the financial year.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.AdjustToPeriodStart
member.summary: When set to true, tells the system to align the start and end dates of the periods with the start and end dates of the corresponding calendar periods. Relevant only for Month ("MO"), Two Months ("BM") and Quarter ("QR") period types.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.GL.FinYearSetup.BelongsToNextYear
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must set the financial year to the one, following the year of the selected start date of the year.
member.value: For example, if the selected start date is 10/28/2014 and this option is set to true, the will be 2015. If this option is set to false, for the same date will be 2014.

member.summary: When true, indicates that the length of the periods of the year in days is fixed. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.summary: Internal type of periods of the year. Read-only field.
member.value: The value of this field is determined by the field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier
member.summary: Represents a Carrier used by the company for shipping goods or a company's own shipping option. The records of this type are created and edited through the Ship Via Codes (CS.20.75.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph). If the feature is enabled, the corresponding settings and plugins are defined through the Carriers (CS.20.77.00) screen (Corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierID
member.summary: Key field. A unique code of a non-integrated carrier, a method of the integrated carrier or a shipping option of the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalcMethod
member.summary: The method used to calculate freight charges using the rate breakdown specified in the related records.
member.value: Allowed values are: "P" - Per Unit, "N" - Net (flat rates), "M" - Manual. Defaults to Manual ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.Description
member.summary: The description of the carrier or shipping option.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.TaxCategoryID
member.summary: Identifier of the Tax Category to be applied to the freight amount when goods are shipped with this shipping option.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CalendarID
member.summary: The Calendar associated with the carrier, which reflects its work hours and the days when it ships the goods.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger income , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightSalesSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the company.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseAcctID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger expense , that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.FreightExpenseSubID
member.summary: Identifier of the General Ledger Subaccount, that is used to record the freight charges to be paid to the Carrier.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.BaseRate
member.summary: The flat-rate charge, which is added to the freight amount calculated according to the related records. This field is relevan only if is set to false.
member.value: Defaults to 0.0.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsExternal
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that the system must use a plugin, specified in the field, to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if the feature is enabled.
member.value: Defaults to false.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.CarrierPluginID
member.summary: Identifier of the used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PluginMethod
member.summary: The code of the Service Method of the Carrier Plugin that is used to provide integration with the carrier for this shipping option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.ConfirmationRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that to confirm the shipment the system will require confirmation for each package used for shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.PackageRequired
member.summary: When set to true, indicates that at least one package must be specified to create (and confirm) a shipment with this shipment option. This field is relevant only if is set to true.
member.value: Defaults to true.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.IsCommonCarrier
member.summary: Indicates whether the carrier is a common carrier. Because common carriers deliver goods from a company branch to the customer location that is a selling point, the value of this field affects the set of taxes that applies to the corresponding invoice.
member.value: When set to true, the carrier is considered common and hence the taxes from the customer's tax zone are applied. Otherwise, the system applies the taxes from the taz zone associated with the selling branch.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Carrier.NoteID
member.summary: Identifier of the Note object, associated with the document.
member.value: Corresponds to the Note.NoteID field.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.CS.Terms
member.summary: Represents Credit Terms used for Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable documents. The records of this type are created and edited through the Credit Terms (CS.20.65.00) (corresponds to the graph).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.TermsID
member.summary: Key field. Unique identifier of the Credit Terms record.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.Descr
member.summary: The description of the Credit Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.VisibleTo
member.summary: Determines the categories of Business Accounts, for whom these terms can be used.
member.value: Allowed values are: "AL" - All, "VE" - Vendors only, "CU" - Customers only, "DS" - Disabled (can't be selected for Business Accounts or documents of any module). Defaults to "AL" - All.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DueType
member.summary: Determines the way the Due Date is calucalated for documents under these Terms.
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month, "C" - Custom. Defaults to "N" - Fixed Number of Days.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue00
member.summary: Defines the first Due Date for the terms. The meaning of this field varies depending on the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom00
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo00
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the first due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDue01
member.summary: The second Due Date used with Custom ("C") (see and ). Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayFrom01
member.summary: The start day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayTo01
member.summary: The end day of the range, for which the Due Date of the document is set to the second due date. This field is relevant only for the Terms with Custom ("C") . Corresponds to a day of the month.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscType
member.summary: Defines how the system determines whether Cash Discount is applicable for a document under these Terms on a particular date .
member.value: Allowed values are: "N" - Fixed Number of Days, "D" - Day of Next Month, "E" - End of Month, "M" - End of Next Month, "T" - Day of the Month, "P" - Fixed Number of Days starting Next Month. Defaults to Fixed Number of Days ("N").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DayDisc
member.summary: The number of days or a particular day of the month (depending on the value of ), during/before which the Cash Discount is applicable for the document.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.DiscPercent
member.summary: The percent of the Cash Discount under these Terms.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentType
member.summary: The type of installment.
member.value: Allowed values are: "S" - Single, "M" - Multiple. Defaults to Single ("S").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentCntr
member.summary: The number of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentFreq
member.summary: The frequency of Installments for these Terms. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M") and the is not Split by Percents in Table ("S").
member.value: Allowed values are: "W" - Weekly, "M" - Monthly, "B" - Semi-monthly (the second installment comes a half a month after the first one, and so on).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.CS.Terms.InstallmentMthd
member.summary: The method, according to which the amounts of installments are calculated. The field is relevant only if the is Multiple ("M").
member.value: Allowed values are: "E" - Equal Parts, "A" - All Tax in First Installment (the total amount before tax is split equally between installments and the entire amount of tax is added to the first installment), "S" - Split by Percents in Table (the days and amounts of installments are defined by the related records).

member.name: T:PX.Objects.FA.SubAccountMaskAttribute
member.summary: A subaccount mask that is used to generate the subaccounts of the fixed asset.
member.value:
The string mask for the SUBACCOUNT segmented key with the appropriate structure. The mask can contain the following mask symbols:
A The subaccount source is a fixed asset,
C The subaccount source is a fixed asset class,
L The subaccount source is a location,
D The subaccount source is a department,
By default, the mask contains only "C" symbols (which means that the only subaccount source is a fixed asset class).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.FA.FABookHistory.Reopen
member.summary: A flag that indicates (if set to true) that the financial period is reopened.
member.value: The financial period becomes reopen, if, in the financial period, negative depreciation adjustment to zero amount has been performed manually. By default, the value is set to false.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule
member.summary: Encapsulates information about a deferred revenue or deferred expense recognition schedule produced by an Accounts Payable or an Accounts Receivable document line. The entities of this type are usually created automatically upon the release of the document line (see e.g. ) that has a deferral code specified. A user can also create a custom deferral schedule (or edit an existing one) by using the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.ScheduleID
member.summary: The unique integer identifier of the deferral schedule.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.DocType

member.value: Corresponds to either the field or the field. This field can have one of the values defined by the or class.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.Module
member.summary: The module from which the deferral schedule originates.
member.value: This field can have one of the following values: "AR": Accounts Receivable, "AP": Accounts Payable. If the module specified is Accounts Payable, the record is a deferred expense recognition schedule. If the module specified is Accounts Receivable, the record is a deferred revenue recognition schedule. The value of this field depends on the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRSchedule.RefNbr
member.summary: The reference number of the document that the deferral schedule corresponds to.
member.value: Corresponds to either the or the field. This field can be empty for custom deferral schedules that are not attached to any document.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran
member.summary: Represents a deferred revenue or expense recognition transaction. Encapsulates the amount to be recognized (or projected to be recognized) on a particular date and in a particular financial period. The entities of this type are created by upon the release of or document lines containing a deferral code. Deferral transactions can be added or edited by the user on the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.ScheduleID
member.summary: The identifier of the parent deferral schedule. This field is a part of the compound key of the record and is a part of the foreign key reference to .
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.LineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the deferral transaction. This field is defaulted from the current value of the field of the parent schedule component.
member.remarks: If the value of this field is equal to the value of of the parent schedule component, the deferral transaction is a "credit line transaction", which means that the whole deferral amount of the parent component should be posted to the deferred revenue or expense account. Otherwise, the deferral transaction is a normal deferred revenue or expense recognition transaction.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleTran.BranchID

member.name: T:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail
member.summary: Represents a revenue or expense recognition component of a deferral schedule. This entity encapsulates the inventory item component level information of the deferral schedule. Usually, deferral schedules contain a single component corresponding to the inventory item specified in the source document line. However, multiple components can be present in case the inventory item associated with the document line is a multiple deliverable arrangement (MDA), or when custom deferral components are added by the user. The entities of this type are edited on the Deferral Schedule (DR201500) form, which corresponds to the graph.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.ScheduleID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the parent deferral schedule. This field is a part of the compound key of the record.
member.value: Corresponds to the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.ComponentID
member.summary: The unique identifier of the inventory item (or one of its components, in case of a multiple deliverable arrangement) associated with the schedule component. This field is a part of the compound key of the record.
member.value: Corresponds to the field. If the schedule component originates from a document line with no inventory item specified, the value of this field is equal to .
member.remarks: Within a deferral schedule, there can be only one schedule component with equal to .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.DetailLineNbr
member.summary: The line number of the component. This field is defaulted from the current value of the field of the parent deferred schedule.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.Module
member.summary: The module associated with the schedule component. This field defaults to .
member.value: This field can have one of the following values: "AP": Accounts Payable, "AR": Accounts Receivable.
member.remarks: Any changes made to this field also affect the value of the field.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.DocType
member.summary: The type of the document from which the schedule component has been created. The value defaults to .

member.name: P:PX.Objects.DR.DRScheduleDetail.RefNbr

member.summary: The remaining deferred revenue or expense amount to be recognized upon the release of deferral transactions associated with the component.
member.value: For normal components, the value of this field is initially equal to , and is decreased during the /// revenue or expense recognition process (which is performed on the Run Recognition (DR501000) form). For residual components of multiple deliverable arrangement items (for which the flag is set to true), this value is zero because the amount is directly posted to the AP or AR account without deferral.

Specialized for SOOrder version of the

and also define a link between numbering ID's defined in SO Order Type: namely SOOrderType.orderNumberingID.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOInvoiceNbrAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOInvoice version of the InvoiceNbrAttribute.
The main purpose of the attribute is poviding of the uniqueness of the RefNbr
amoung a set of documents of the specifyed types (for example, each RefNbr of the ARInvoice
the ARInvoices must be unique across all ARInvoices and AR Debit memos)
This may be useful, if user has configured a manual numberin for SOInvoices
or needs to create SOInvoice from another document (like SOOrder) allowing to type RefNbr
for the to-be-created Invoice manually. To store the numbers, system using ARInvoiceNbr table,
keyed uniquelly by DocType and RefNbr. A source document is linked to a number by NoteID.
Attributes checks a number for uniqueness on FieldVerifying and RowPersisting events.

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOTaxAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SO version of the TaxAttribute.
Provides Tax calculation for SOLine, by default is attached to SOLine (details) and SOOrder (header)
Normally, should be placed on the TaxCategoryID field.
Internally, it uses SOOrder graphs, otherwise taxes are not calculated (tax calc Level is set to NoCalc).
As a result of this attribute work a set of SOTax tran related to each SOLine and to their parent will created
May be combined with other attrbibutes with similar type - for example, SOOpenTaxAttribute

member.name: T:PX.Objects.SO.SOLineInventoryItemAttribute
member.summary:
Specialized for SOLine version of the CrossItemAttribute.
Providing an Inventory ID selector for the field, it allows also user
to select both InventoryID and SubItemID by typing AlternateID in the control
As a result, if user type a correct Alternate id, values for InventoryID, SubItemID,
and AlternateID fields in the row will be set.
In this attribute, InventoryItems with a status inactive, markedForDeletion,
noSale and noRequest are filtered out. It also fixes INPrimaryAlternateType parameter to CPN
This attribute may be used in combination with AlternativeItemAttribute on the AlternateID field of the row
[SOLineInventoryItem(Filterable = true)]

member.name: T:PX.Objects.TX.TaxTran
member.summary:
Represents a tax transaction. The entity serves for the following two purposes simultaneously:
To report the tax amount, which is stored in the TaxTran record, to a tax period. A tax report is built by TaxTran records, and reportable TaxTran records belong to the specified tax period after the tax report is prepared.
To store the tax amount of the document for each applied tax.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.TaxTran.Selected
member.summary: Indicates (if set to true) that the tax transaction is selected on a form.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.TaxTran.Module
member.summary: The source module of the record. The field is a part of the primary key.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.TaxTran.TranType
member.summary: The type of the record.
member.value: If the record is related to a document, the field contains the type of the document. In other cases, the field contains one of the following values: TFW: GL tax record TRV: GL tax record INT: Output tax adjustment RET: Input tax adjustment VTI: Input VAT VTO: Output VAT REI: Reverse input VAT REO: Reverse output VAT

member.name: T:PX.Objects.TX.Tax
member.summary: Represents a tax.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxID
member.summary: The tax ID. This is the key field, which can be specified by the user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.Descr
member.summary: The description of the tax, which can be specified by the user.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxType
member.summary: The type of the tax.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "S": Sales tax. "P": Use (purchase) tax. "V": Value-added tax (VAT). "W": Withholding.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcType
member.summary: The basis of the tax calculation.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "D": A tax is calculated on a document basis. "I": A tax is calculated on a per-line basis.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcLevel
member.summary: The tax level.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "0": An inclusive tax. "1": A first-level exclusive tax. "2": A second-level exclusive tax.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcRule
member.summary: The aggregated rule of tax calculation based on and .
member.value: The field can have the following values: "I0": The tax amount is included in item amounts and should be extracted. "I1": The tax is a first-level tax calculated on item amounts. "I2": The tax is a second-level tax calculated on item amounts. "D1": The tax is a first-level tax calculated on the document amount. "D2": The tax is a second-level tax calculated on the document amount.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxCalcLevel2Exclude
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the system should exclude the first-level tax amount from the tax base that is used for calculation of the second-level tax amount. The flag is applicable to only first-level taxes.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.TaxApplyTermsDisc
member.summary: The method of calculating the tax base amount if a cash discount is applied.
member.value: The field can have the following values: "X": Reduce the taxable amount. "P": Reduce taxable amount on early payment. "N": Do not affect taxable amount.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.PendingTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a pending VAT. The pending VAT should be calculated in documents, but should not be recorded in the tax report. Later the VAT of the pending type can be converted into the general VAT.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ReverseTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a reverse VAT. When the reverse VAT is applied to a company that supplies goods or service to other EU countries, the liability of reporting VAT is reversed and goes to the customer rather than to the vendor.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.IncludeInTaxable
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the VAT taxable amount should be displayed in the VAT Taxable Total box in the documents, such as bills and invoices.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ExemptTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the calculated amount should be displayed in the VAT Exempt Total box in the documents, such as bills and invoices.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.StatisticalTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a statistical VAT. The statistical VAT is calculated for statistical purposes; the VAT is reported but not paid.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.DirectTax
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax can be entered only by the documents from the Tax Bills and Adjustments form (TX303000).

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.DeductibleVAT
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the tax is a deductible VAT, which means that a company is allowed to deduct some part of the tax paid to a vendor from its own VAT liability to the government.

member.name: P:PX.Objects.TX.Tax.ReportExpenseToSingleAccount
member.summary: Specifies (if set to true) that the non-deductible part should be posted to the Tax Expense account.
